Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz, a sus 54 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar. Inicialmente el negocio lo abrió su esposo con el ánimo de generar los recursos económicos necesarios para su familia, pero desde hace 4 años ella se encarga totalmente del establecimiento debido a que el señor comenzó a trabajar en construcción. Durante este tiempo la tienda ha crecido y se ha dado a conocer en el sector, donde sus clientes cada vez se satisfacen más por el servicio prestado, ya que es organizado y está bien surtido, lo que genera una buena imagen para su establecimiento. La cliente utilizará el crédito para comprar más surtido (productos lácteos, cárnicos, productos de aseo, aceites, granos, pastas, galletería, mecato, entre otros), de esta manera podrá tener mayor disponibilidad y variedad de productos que le solicitan sus clientes y a veces no posee, así evitará perder ventas y, por el contrario tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía del hogar. Luz manifiesta que su principal desafío son el alza de los precios de algunos productos y la competencia, sin embargo esto no la detiene para seguir luchando y avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, pues sueña con ampliar su tienda para que le genere más rentabilidad y así poder terminar de pagar las cuotas de su vivienda propia, en la que podrán disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz is 54 years old and lives with her husband and her son. She works at her own business, a grocery store where she offers all kinds of products for the family food basket. Initially, her husband started the business with the aim of generating the necessary income for their family, but 4 years ago Luz took over the business completely as her husband started working in construction. During this time the shop has grown and has become known in the area, where her clients are more and more satisfied with the service offered, since it is organized and well stocked - which projects a good image of her business.

Luz will use the loan to buy more stock (dairy products, meat products, cleaning products, oils, grains, pasta, cookies, pastries etc.), and thus she will be able to have a larger amount and variety of products. Sometimes customers ask her for products that she has run out of, and so this will help her to avoid losing sales and also give her the opportunity to increase her income to continue supporting the family finances. 

Luz says that her biggest challenge is the increase in prices of some products and her competition. However, this will not stop her from continuing to fight and make progress towards completing her objectives, as her wish is to expand her business to generate more profit. This will mean that she is able to finish paying the fees on her own home, and so enjoy a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an experienced agronomist from the village Achajour in the Tavush region. Her family consists of her husband, her school-age son and daughter, and her elderly father-in-law. 

Susanna, with the help of her family members, is engaged in breeding cows, sheep, hens and turkeys. She is also cultivating wheat, grass and several fruits (plum, fig, blood orange, grapes, apple, pear and walnut). Farming is the only source of income for the family. Susanna's husband helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

As the family's needs are increasing day by day, they need to find more sources of income to cover their basic needs. For this reason, Susanna needs a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a heifer and some forage for the livestock. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Susanna and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will in helping them collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a private entrepreneur from Gyumri city in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife and two little children (8 and 5 years old). 

Karen runs a retail shop of shoes and clothes. His store was very small and was located in the territory of a bigger market previously. It's already four months since he has changed the location of the store to a central one; he has also expanded the store. 

He currently needs to develop his business further to be able to more effectively meet the increasing needs of his family. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support to this ambitious entrepreneur and will enable him to buy a new assortment of goods (shoes and clothes) to resell in his store. 

Karen and his family will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping them to collect the needed amount of loan to improve and develop their business.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shoes and clothes to resell in his store.

loans.name: Seneida María

texts.es: Seneida, a sus 52 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Se dedica a trabajar en su negocio, una papelería que inició hace varios años, aprovechando la ventaja de estar ubicada cerca a un colegio, donde los niños carecían de un establecimiento cercano que ofreciera estos productos.  Trabaja todos los días y ha notado que su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de una fotocopiadora e impresora, realizar unas adecuaciones locativas y comprar surtido al por mayor (lápices, cuadernos, colores, entre otros) de esta forma podrá aumentar los servicios que presta y tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para satisfacer los requerimientos de su clientela. Esto se reflejará positivamente en el incremento de sus ingresos, con lo que espera cumplir el sueño de  ampliar su negocio, tenerlo más surtido y aumentar así su clientela. Seneida es consciente que para lograrlo debe seguir trabajando con empeño y dedicación para poder tener una estabilidad económica favorable y disfrutar con su familia de un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Seneida, 52, is married and the mother of five children.  She makes a living working in her business, a school supplies store she started several years ago to take advantage of being located near a school where the children needed a nearby store that sold these products.  She works every day and has noticed that her business keeps on growing little by little.

Seneida wants to use the loan she's requesting to buy a photocopier and printer, to make some modifications to her space, and to buy supplies wholesale (pencils, notebooks, colored pencils, and others).  This way she'll be able to expand the services she provides and have a greater variety of items to sell and satisfy her customers' needs.  This will be reflected in an increase in her sales.

Seneida hopes to achieve her dreams of expanding her business and having it better supplied to increase her clientele.  She knows that to do this she has to keep on working with determination and dedication to have good economic stability and enjoy greater well-being with her family.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and printer, to modify her space, and to buy supplies

loans.name: Esmaragdo

texts.es: Esmaragdo, con 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos. Lleva más de 30 años dedicado a la ebanistería, trabajando en su propio taller, elabora diferentes artículos en madera según los requerimientos de sus clientes, por problemas de salud se vio obligado a cerrar su taller, debido a esto su familia entró en una crisis económica. Sin embargo, luego de luchar contra su enfermedad, hace 3 meses abrió nuevamente su taller en el cual trabaja todos los días en horas de la tarde, pues alterna su labor trabajando como empleado en otros negocios similares para complementar los ingresos con los cuales solventa las necesidades básicas de su hogar. El cliente es un hombre que se esfuerza por salir adelante, trabajador y pujante, siempre va en busca de alternativas que le ayuden a progresar, por esto se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará activos fijos (sierra sinfín, máquina pulidora y rotadora) y realizará adecuaciones locativas; esto le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá realizar la entrega de los productos de manera oportuna con un excelente acabado, cuidando el reconocimiento que posee por la calidad de sus productos. Esmaragdo desea seguir trabajando arduamente para que en un futuro cercano pueda dedicarse tiempo completo a su taller y espera que éste le genere los recursos económicos suficientes para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esmaragdo, 53, lives with his wife and two children.  He’s been a cabinetmaker for more than 30 years working in his own shop.  He manufactures various items out of wood according to his customers’ wishes.  Health problems forced him to close his shop and his family was plunged into an economic crisis as a result.  However, once vanquishing his illness, he reopened his shop three months ago and works there every evening for he earns extra income also working as an employee in other similar firms in order to cover his basic household needs.

He is a man that strives to get ahead; he’s hardworking and determined and is always seeking alternatives that will lead to progress which is what motivates him to request support from a loan to buy fixed assets (band saw, sanding machine and lathe).  He will also make physical improvements to his shop to provide better service and be able to deliver excellently finished items in a timely fashion thus maintaining the good reputation he’s earned because of the quality of his products.

Esmaragdo wants to continue to work hard so that in the near future he will be able to work full-time in his shop that he hopes it will generate sufficient income to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy machinery and to make some physical improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 60 years old. She will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, Esperance wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf. All borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing, as well as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers during maize production.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha is from Agarak city in the Syuniq region. He lives with his mother and his wife. Seryozha and his mother work in the factory. To be able to meet their needs, the family is also engaged in keeping a cow and in cultivation of several fruits (peach, cherry, plum, quince, pomegranate, fig, blood orange, pear and walnuts). The fruits of this particular region are famous all over the country and have high demand in the market. 

Seryozha currently wants to increase the number of cattle to be able to cover the increasing needs of his family. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working man and his family and will help them purchase three cows. Seryoja and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful for helping them to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer de 35 años de edad que durante 11 años ha trabajado como empleada en diferentes restaurantes ubicados en el centro de la ciudad, pero, desde hace 3 años el jefe del último restaurante en el que trabajó le dio la oportunidad de librar el negocio para que ella se quedara con él y así fue como se convirtió en propietaria de su actual negocio. Cuenta con el apoyo de 3 empleados directos y trabajan todos los días desde las 8:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm; de esta manera ha logrado generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer trabajadora, pujante y activa que lucha constantemente para sacar adelante su negocio, por esta razón solicita el crédito para comprar insumos (verduras, granos, arroz, gaseosas, mecato, frutas y licor) así tendrá los materiales disponibles para preparar los alimentos y satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales, pues de ellos dependen los buenos resultados que obtiene en su labor. Sandra pretende seguir trabajando arduamente para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de montar otra sucursal de su restaurante, ubicado también en el sector donde ya es reconocida y, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old. For a period of 11 years she was employed at various restaurants throughout the city center, but 3 years ago, she became the owner of a restaurant, when her boss at the time left the business and granted her the opportunity to take over the place. This is how Sandra became a business owner.

She has the support of 3 employees, and together work every day from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm. This is how Sandra has been able to generate the income to meet the basic needs of her home. Sandra is very hardworking, dedicated and active, and she works relentlessly to ensure that her business thrives. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy supplies (such as vegetables, dry grains, rice, soft drinks, snacks, fruits and liquors), to have various ingredients needed to prepare the dishes to suit her customers' requests, as it is from them that the positive outcome of her business depends on. 

Sandra plans to continue to work very hard, so that one day she may accomplish her dream to open another restaurant, situated in the same area where she is now well-known, and in this way, continue to improve her livelihood and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies like vegetables, dry grains, rice, soft drinks, snacks, fruits and liquors

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory came to the United States from the Dominican Republic ready to build a new life for himself. He found a fresh start distributing hair care products for a large company. Over time, he found that the many hair salons he was selling to were looking for fresh new products. Gregory saw his chance to finally be in business for himself and earn enough to be financially independent. 

Gregory’s business imports hair products and sells them to beauty salons. The business has been growing substantially and Gregory has used his savings to purchase a new warehouse space. With this loan, Gregory will be able to fill the warehouse with enough hair products, allowing him to reach more clients. The loan will also help Gregory build his credit, allowing him to receive a larger loan in the future.

Help Gregory grow his business and build a better life for himself.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise in order to meet the growing demand for his products.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is looking forward to having the financial freedom to enjoy his family and start his own charity projects one day. His first step was to move from Colombia to Miami. After arriving, he found a job working for a manufacturer of consumables for cutting and welding. While earning money for his family, he developed strong relationships with businesses in need of other industrial products. This need sparked a new idea and, almost six years ago, Luis started his own business, Bumar International.

Luis has reached a pivotal point. The businesses he supplies products to are beginning to grow and expand. Luis has the opportunity to grow with them; but he needs the inventory in order to do so. With this loan, Luis will be able to purchase the goods to fulfill his customer’s demand. 

Help Luis grow his business and be able to spend more time with his family and help others in his community.

Check out Luis’s business: http://www.bumarinternational.com/

loans.use: To purchase the industrial products requested by a new contract

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
Imagine raising two sons by yourself and still having the energy to implement your vision. You could be picturing Frances. A native of Boston, Frances has worked in the IT industry for many years while putting her two teenage sons through school. All the while, she has had a vision for software products aimed at understanding cultural differences, history, education and commerce around the world. She has spent years investigating the market and is finally ready to launch her business and her first product.

Before she launches, however, she needs to hire lawyers to patent her product. She’s been able to fund herself entirely up until this point. With this loan, Frances will able to protect her intellectual property and launch her first product.  

Help a single mother launch her vision and fund an education for her two sons.

loans.use: to pay legal fees to patent her software product

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Two and a half years ago, Juan and his wife Ingrid came to the United States with the hope of leading more financially independent lives. One year ago, Juan started his own business, J&I Mobile Express. 

Juan had worked in a similar business doing technical assistance and also had been working in the same field in the Dominican Republic, his natal country. He sells mobile phones and accessories, offers repairs, and also offers remittance services to Latin America. His store is located within a large laundromat and he opens 7 days a week from 10:00 am to 7:00 pm. 

"I started my own business because I wanted personal growth... the business is actually my passion. I like to offer great customer service and meet customer expectations," he says. Juan needs a loan in order to pay for a new computer and buy more inventory to meet the growing demand. He hopes to someday expand his store into its own location.

Help Juan achieve his entrepreneurial dreams!

loans.use: To pay for a computer and more inventory.

loans.name: Oscar Jesus

texts.es: Oscar de 46 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 18 años. Desde hace 10 años, Oscar se ha dedicado a la actividad comercial, desde su propio negocio, vendiendo ropa, y electrodomésticos, pero antes, desde muy joven trabajaba en ello para otros. Sus ventas de hoy las realiza de contado, con una frecuencia diaria, todos los días de la semana y desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza  en un municipio fronterizo, donde consigue precios especiales y directamente a sus proveedores. Los principales clientes de Oscar son sus propios vecinos y familiares; su meta es incrementar las ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida en su familia y aunque su mayor desafío consiste en alcanzar fuentes de financiación, hoy ha logrado un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, jeans, y electrodomésticos, porque pretende aumentar los inventarios para vender mucho mas y ganar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Oscar is 46 years old and lives in the municipality of Malambo, which is a metropolitan section of the city.  He lives with his wife and his two children, ages 14 and 18.  For the past 10 years, Oscar has managed his own retail business in which he sells clothes and household appliances.  He previously worked for other people since he was a young man.  

Oscar currently conducts cash sales on a daily basis.  He works every day of the week from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M.  Oscar makes his sales at a border town where he is able to obtain special prices directly from his suppliers.  His main customers are neighbors and relatives.  Oscar’s goal is to increase his sales and improve his family’s quality of life.  However, his greatest challenge has been obtaining funding sources.  Today he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the money to buy clothing, jeans, and household appliances because he intends to increase his inventory.  This will enable him to sell more and earn a little more profit.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jeans, and household appliances to sell.

loans.name: Donaldo De Jesus

texts.es: Donaldo de 34 años habita al norte de la ciudad y con su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años. Desde hace 5 años su madre le propuso iniciar el negocio de preparación y venta de comidas corrientes. La idea fue puesta en marcha y resultó exitosa, porque muy pronto llegaron al negocio sus clientes y con ellos muchos referidos. Hoy vende almuerzos en la mañana y todo lo que es fritura por las tardes; su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio donde vende de contado y a crédito durante todos los días,  desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza en depósitos de víveres en el centro de la ciudad, de contado, para obtener buenos precios y trasladarlos a su clientela a quien quiere tener satisfecha para lograr su retorno. Donaldo tiene como meta independizar el negocio de su vivienda  y más adelante comprar su casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finánciamelo que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, como arroz, aceite, harinas; con ello se propone aumentar su capacidad productiva y con ello las ventas y las utilidades.
texts.en:
Donaldo, age 34, lives to the north of the city with his wife and their four year old child.  Five years ago his mother suggested to him starting the business of preparing and selling daily meal specials.  The idea was put into motion, and the result was successful.  This is because his customers came to his business very quickly, and with his customers he got a lot of referrals.

He now sells lunches in the mornings and all kinds of snacks in the afternoons.  His business is located at his home, and he sells for cash and credit every day from five in the morning until seven in the evening.

He makes his purchases at supply warehouses in the center of the city.  He buys for cash in order to get good prices and pass those on to his clientele.  He wants them to be satisfied in order for them to return.

Donald’s goal is to have the business independent of his home.  Later, he wants to buy his house.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy supplies like rice, cooking oil, and flour.  He will do this in order to increase his production capacity.  With this he will increase sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is dedicated to her family. A natural entrepreneur, she started a business in order to provide a livelihood for herself and her mother. Her business, Sisi's Mobile Grooming, offers a unique service where the dog groomer comes to you. Cecilia’s mother, an experienced dog groomer, works one-on-one with customers while Cecilia, who is pursuing her degree in business management, runs the business side. 

“We have been blessed to draw thousands of customers and be busy all day long,” explains Cecilia.

With popularity comes an obstacle. There is more demand than one mobile grooming truck can service in a day. With this loan, Cecilia will be able to purchase additional blow dryers, clippers, and dog grooming tables and tubs in order to service her growing customer base. 

Help Cecilia expand her business and support her mother’s passion as a livelihood. 

Check out Sisi's Mobile Grooming online: http://www.sisimobilegrooming.com/

loans.use: To purchase additional dog grooming equipment

loans.name: Riccardo

texts.en:
Do you know what an Arepa is? When Riccardo moved to his neighborhood in Queens, NY, he was dismayed to find that no one in the area was familiar with this Venezuelan specialty. After 10 years of working as a truffle salesman, he decided to bring his dish to light in the community by opening up his own restaurant. Arepas Café started out as just a tiny restaurant, but was instantly popular in the community. One year after opening, Riccardo saw an opportunity to expand the size of the restaurant and increase his staff to 14. Riccardo employs many members of the community, including his teenage daughter.  

Arepas Café has become quite popular in Queens. It has received 4 stars on Yelp and brings in locals from all different walks of life. After accomplishing one dream, Riccardo has set his sights even higher. He has purchased a second location and needs a loan in order to stock up the restaurant and spread the word about his new location. 

Help Riccardo open up a new restaurant and bring the unique flavor of his dish to a new community.

loans.use: To stock up his new restaurant and spread the word to potential customers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old and is married with 2 children.

In 2010, Mary Jane applied for membership with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative (PMPC).  On hearing of all the benefits, she did not hesitate to become a member. She maintains her member status in good standing and makes her loan repayments in a timely manner.

Mary Jane is asking for financial assistance of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional tools for farming and farm supplies. Through this loan she hopes to increase her income and facilitate the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for farming and farm supplies.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 27 years old, married, and has one child.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en: Alda is requesting a loan for $600 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her support her family, and will use the loan to buy petrol and diesel to sell. She opened her kiosk a year ago using her own working capital of $300.  She is a hard-working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy petrol and diesel.

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en: Charisma is married and works hard to support her family by running a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy additional ingredients like rice, sugar and milk. She has been in this line of work for two years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional food items to sell such as rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 26 years old, with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
Leilanie works hard to support her family. Leilanie is married and has a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines.

Leilanie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Leilanie has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and lives in Dao, Pagadian City. She is married, with four children.

Mary Jane has a retail business where she sells a variety of things. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan to have capital for her retail business, like basic commodities.

Mary Jane has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, she hopes to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: to expand her retail business by buying additional inventories.

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 34 years old and married with one child who is at school. Jean works very hard to provide for her family.

Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as candies, biscuits and groceries etc.

Jean has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as candies, biscuits and groceries etc.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is 59 years old, married and the mother of five children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar and cream. Lucila has been in this business for 23 years, and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy clothing and other dressmaking materials for her tailoring business.

Alma has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and other dressmaking materials for her business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar and shampoo. She has borrowed and repaid three  loans from NWTF prior to this one, and has been running her general store for four years. She supplements her income by farming rice. Her goal is to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anchita

texts.en:
Anchita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Anchita has been in this business for 25 years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell bamboo.

Anchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Joecel

texts.en:
Joecel is 28 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Joecel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy pesticides and other farm supplies.

Joecel has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Daisy Mae

texts.en: Daisy Mae lives in the village of Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children who are now adults. In 2012, Daisy Mae joined PMPC to secure the benefits of being a member. Since joining, she has remained a member in good standing who has repaid her obligations in a timely manner. Recently, Daisy Mae requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy wood, glue, varnish, nails and sandpaper. With this loan, she hopes to expand her furniture-making business. She has found the assistance she needed from the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and is very thankful for this support.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, varnish, nail and sandpaper.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Marilou is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP)  through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of rice to sell through her buy-and-sell rice business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell herbal products.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Corazon has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Rosie has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 37 years old and married, with three children.

Jeneth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like snack foods, noodles, soap, shampoo, coffee, and sugar.

Jeneth has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and she also earns an income from buy-and-sell crabs.

Jeneth aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like snack foods, noodles, soap, shampoo, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from farming rice. Helen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials needed for her repair shop business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her repair shop business.

loans.name: Luz Marie

texts.en:
Luz Marie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell through her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Luz Marie has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell bamboo.

Luz Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bolortuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolortuya, 29 years old, lives alone in an old house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. In 2010, she and her husband had a traffic accident and unfortunately her husband died. Her daughter is five years old and lives with her parents in the countryside. Two years ago, Bolortuya began working as a manager at a private firm. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of MNT 7,700,000 to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam, to renovate her old house. 

After renovation, Bolortuya wants to bring her daughter back to Ulaanbaatar to educate her in kindergarten. Also, the renovated house will enable the duo to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 63 years old and married, with seven children.

Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

Mildred has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 20 years and she also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Mildred aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business, like flour, sugar, and milk.

Juanita has been in this business for 22 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business, like flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Edgar Jeovany

texts.es: Edgar, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, y tiene 10 años de cultivar café, esta producción la vende a intermediarios de la zona. Actualmente solicita 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para su finca y también sembrar una manzana mas de café. con esta inversión tendrá mejor cosecha ya que necesitaba de una asistencia. Su plan es mejorar la finca para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edgar is 26 years old and single. He lives in the municipality of Gracias in the Department of Lempira. Edgar has always worked in agriculture, and he has been growing coffee for more than ten years. He sells what he produces to coffee resellers in the area.

Edgar is requesting this loan for 10,000 HNL to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm, and to plant an additional field of coffee. He says that his land needs some maintenance, and he hopes that the loan will help him to have a better harvest and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm and to plant an additional field of coffee.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Amy works hard to support her family.

She has a barber shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Amy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy new equipment for her barber shop.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her barber shop.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 38 years old and married, with two children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for 11 years and she has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elsie aspires to save money to send her children to school and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jainema

texts.en:
Jainema is 48 years old and married, with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jainema has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items, like soft drinks, soap, and other groceries.

Jainema has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos los cuales son todos independientes,vive en casa propia ocupando una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Seguencoma de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe una renta de jubilación mensual y también obtiene ingresos diarios de la venta en su tienda de barrio,el crédito lo requiere para invertirlo en su salud ya que el es de la tercera edad y se encuentra un poco delicado de salud y necesita unos examenes medicos del corazon y pulmones.
Con todos los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Abel  es convertir a su tienda en almacén para mejorar sus ingresos ya que es la única actividad a la que se dedica por completo, de esta forma mejorara su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Abel is married and has four children who are now independent.  Abel lives in his own house, which has only one room.  The house is in the Alto Seguencoma area of the city of La Paz.

Abel currently receives a monthly pension and has a daily income from sales in his corner shop.  He needs a loan to invest in his health as he is older now and has health problems.  Abel needs some tests done on his heart and lungs.

Abel is able to cover the costs of food and paying for basic services with his income

Abel's dream is to expand his shop in order to increase his income as this is his only full-time work.  With a larger shop he will improve his quality of life.

This is Abel's third loan with IMPRO, and his second with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests for the heart and lungs.

loans.name: Melba Rosa

texts.es: Melba es una mujer campesina de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su único hijo. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura y actualmente, en compañía de su esposo poseen cultivos de café en 2 lotes de tierra de su propiedad y la cosecha recolectada es vendida en el mercado, de esta manera genera los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos y necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente se caracteriza por su pujanza y tiene un espíritu de superación que le ha permitido lograr los objetivos que se propone. Solicita un séptimo ciclo de crédito que desea invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas) que son necesarios para preparar la tierra para la temporada de cosecha, lo que le permitirá recolectar un producto de mejor calidad y le generará un incremento en los ingresos que recibe por las ventas. Melba desea que su actividad sea más rentable y sostenible en el tiempo para así poder lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida y disfrutar con su esposo y su hijo de un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Fifty-five-year-old Melba is a peasant and lives with her husband and only son.  She has worked in agriculture from a young age and, with her husband, she owns coffee crops on their two plots of land.  They sell their harvest in the market and are able to earn the necessary money to cover costs and pay for household necessities.  Melba is a strong woman and fights to overcome obstacles.  With these qualities she has been able to achieve her objectives.  Melba is on her seventh loan cycle and is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies (such as manure, fertilisers, and fungicides) which are necessary in order to prepare the land for harvest.  These products will allow Melba to have a higher quality products and will give her a higher income from sales.  Melba wants her work to be more profitable and more sustainable so that she can have a better quality of life and enjoy better well-being and more financial stability with her husband and son.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (such as manure, fertilisers, and fungicides).

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Gracias a un crédito que Adolfo obtuvo por parte de Kiva la cosecha pasada pudo pagar los gastos que se generaron por contratar a cortadores. Para esta cosecha solicita nuevamente de un crédito para pagar a los caortadores que le ayudaran en el trabajo del campo.
texts.en: Thanks to a credit Adolfo got through Kiva during the past harvest season, he was able to pay for labor to pick his coffee. For this new harvest Adolfo is also requesting a loan to pay the coffee pickers that help him with his field work.

loans.use: to pay for coffee pickers.

loans.name: Barahunda Group

texts.es:
Maricela  es uno de los integrantes del grupo Barahunda, tiene 43 años, estudió la primaria y es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su hogar en el que vende ropa para dama y caballero, zapatos, bisutería  y cosmeticos. Ella ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de bisutería (pulseras, anillos y collares elaborados con materiales de adorno), cosméticos(esmaltes, sombras, delineadores, maquillajes y perfumes), ropa (camisas, blusas, short, vestidos, pantalones, faldas)y zapatos.
 
Maricela espera en un futuro agrandar su local y darles estudios a sus hijos. La señora Maricela se encuentra muy agradecida con VisionFund y con Kiva por haber llevado este programa hasta su comunidad el cual les permite tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
 
Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Maria de Lourdes venta de perfumes
Elia muebleria
Alicia venta de productos naturistas
Victor Luis venta de pescado
Irais Elvira cria de cerdos
Elizabeth cria de cerdos
Perla renta de departamentos
Isamar  venta de bisuteria y articulos par el hogar
Santa venta de refrescos 
Martha venta de carne
texts.en:
Maricela is one member of the "Barahunda" communal bank. She is 43 years old and is the single mother of 2 children. She studied up to primary school. She has a small business in her house where she sells clothing for men and women, shoes, costume jewelry and cosmetics. 

Marciela has requested this loan to invest it in the purchase of costume jewelry (bracelets, rings and necklaces), cosmetics (nail polish, eye shadow, eye liner,  foundation and perfume), clothing (shirts, blouses, shorts, dresses, pants and skirts) and shoes. Maricela hopes to expand her store in the future and provide for the education of her children. Maricela is very pleased that VisionFund and Kiva has brought this program to her community, which allows her to have a higher quality of living. 

The other members of the group are: Maria de Lourdes sells perfume. Elia sells furniture. Alicia sells natural products. Victor Luis sells fish. Irais Elvira raises pigs. Elizabeth also raises pigs. Perla rents apartments. Isamar sells costume jewelry and home decorations. Santa sells soft drinks. Martha sells meat.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, cosmetics, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Diwani

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Diwani works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines; she also earns additional income from a general store. Diwani is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, wood, paint, nails, etc. for her furniture-making business.

Diwani has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bamboo, wood, paint, nails, etc.

loans.name: Jesil

texts.en:
Jesil is 33 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jesil has a frozen food business in the Philippines. Jesil requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Jesil has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jesil would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Haide is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries for harvesting rice and for land preparation.

Haide has been farming rice for 5 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay laborers salaries for harvesting rice and for land preparation.

loans.name: Gloricel

texts.en:
Gloricel is 36 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gloricel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloricel has been farming rice for 7 years, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farm.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Lorna has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 25 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been pig fattening for 6 years, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 43 years old and married with three children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Norma has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal for 5 years, and earns an income from pig fattening.

Norma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nileda

texts.en:
Nileda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nileda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional ingredients for her food business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Nileda would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 44 years old. She is married and has four children; all are studying. She has been engaged in this business for two years, together with her husband. They earn a monthly income of 10,000 PHP. Grace requested a new loan to pay for various sorts of timber. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2010. She is well satisfied with the services and products of Paglaum. She believes that this business could be a bridge to success.

loans.use: to purchase timber

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Tungalag, 41 years old, lives with her parents and sisters in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been working in a textile factory since 2012. Her husband works in Korea on an employment contract. Her parents both have retired from work and get state pension. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, and fiberglass. 

Installing windows and floors as well as insulating with fiberglass will make the house more comfortable and a warmer place for living. Also, the family will burn less coal thus releasing less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, and fiberglass to make the house more comfortable and a warmer place for living.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling sea-shells. Milagros is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 64 years old and widowed with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Melodina has a general store business in the Philippines. Melodina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

Melodina has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Melodina would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is 44 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nanette has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nanette requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nanette has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Nanette would like to save money to expand the business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Zyra

texts.en:
Zyra is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food-vending. Zyra is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Zyra has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years of age, married, and blessed with three children. To make a living, she operates a variety store and transportation business. The couple are working hard to improve their living condition and send their children to higher level of education.

Marilou and her spouse are determined to have a viable source of income and somehow get ahead in life. In this connection, Marilou is seeking additional capital of PHP 10,000.

This amount will be used to buy stocks of merchandises, such as canned goods, eggs ,ingredients, and assorted biscuits for her variety store. She hopes for approval of her requested loan amount so that her goal in life will be realized someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandises, such as canned goods, eggs, and assorted biscuits for her retail store.

loans.name: Melanimfa

texts.en:
Melanimfa is 54 years old and widowed, with three children.

Melanimfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks to sell, like snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries.

Melanimfa has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a buy-and-sell fish business.

Melanimfa aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell, like snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries.

loans.name: Celna

texts.en:
Celna is 50 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school. 

Celna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Celna has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Celna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 46 years old and married, with two children.

Angeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and milk.

Angeles has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Angeles aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and milk.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Analiza is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her charcoal business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married, with two children. She is 45 years old and has been managing her businesses for many years. Her husband is a farmer. They work together for the welfare of their family.     

Mary Ann has managed a hog-raising business for 15 years. She earns 2,500 PHP per pig when they are sold. Aside from this, she also maintains a general store to earn a daily income. 

Due to financial constraints, Mary Ann is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs she is raising, in order to earn a higher income for her family's welfare. Some of the loan will be used to buy grocery items as stock for her store.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 47 years old. She is married and has three children.

Aniceta earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing. 

Aniceta is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aniceta is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a hollow blocks-making business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials, like cement, sand, and gravel.

Elvira has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Eufenia

texts.en:
Eufenia is 59 years old and married, with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Eufenia has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Eufenia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more items, like sardines, snack food, and other grocery products.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items, like sardines, snack food, and other grocery products.

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is 39 years old and married with two children.

Annaly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Annaly has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Annaly aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries for her business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wilfredo es una persona responsable, trabajador, casado, en la actualidad tiene tres hijos menores de edad todos dependen económicamente de él, y su esposa se encarga del cuido de ellos, él labora  como docente  en una escuela pública. Gracias a créditos emitidos por Afodenic mediante financiamientos Kiva ha logrado mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Ahora solicita este crédito  para comprar cerámica que pondrá en los cuartos de habitación, con esta inversión le dará mejores condiciones a su hogar y especialmente a sus hijos quienes habitaran en un ambiente más sano y limpio.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a responsible and hard-working man. He is married, and at the moment he has three children (minors) depending on him financially, and his wife is in charge of looking after them. He works as a teacher in a public school. 

Thanks to the loans offered by Afodenic through Kiva financing he has managed to improve the infrastructure of his home. 

Now he is applying for this loan to buy ceramic, which he will put in the rooms. With this investment he will improve the condition of his home, especially for his children who will live in a healthier and cleaner environment.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, cement, sand.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old, married and blessed with five children. Currently, two of her children go to school. Susan owns and operates a general store. She has been running this kind of business for over five years.

Susan's main goal is to increase the income she generates and to make it a stable source of her family income. With regards to this matter, Susan is seeking additional capital of PHP 7,000 which will allow her to purchase stocks of groceries and rice. She knows that through completeness of grocery items she offers, she could obtain greater income and satisfy all her customer demand. 

Susan is looking forward to approval of her requested loan. In this way, she can keep her general store profitable and a stable source of her family income.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries and rice for her general store.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is a farmer. When he is not busy doing farming activities, he provides motorcycle transportation services for an income. Because of financial difficulty in providing the needed inputs for his farm, he is seeking lenders' assistance to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds.

He is married and now 28 years old. He has one child. He was taking care of his child full-time while his wife was working abroad to support the family's daily basic needs. He patiently works on his transportation business in addition to the farm work. Due to the nature of the farming business, he only earns an income from farming twice a year, approximately 4-5 months apart.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials, such as welding rod, wire, iron, etc. for her motorcycle shop business.

Marites has been in this business for 5 years. Marites earns more income from a general store.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as welding rod, wire, iron, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: This time, Carmen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock of plastic ware and other home products. Her kitchenware business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, and this loan will allow her to continue her business and provide her family with an income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of plastic ware and other home products.

loans.name: Cidel Marie

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Cidel Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Cidel Marie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell.

Cidel Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an old member of BRAC Pakistan and is taking a new loan after repaying two loans. 

Razia's husband drives an auto rickshaw by profession. He hires the rickshaw on a daily basis, but he has to pay fares over it, also. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw, but his savings do not allow him to make any purchases. Therefore, Razia contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and described her financial problems. 

With the amount of the loan, her husband would buy a new auto rickshaw on installments. Razia hopes that her husband could earn sufficient income, so that he could pay the installments on the rickshaw and could repay the loan balance, as well. After buying the new rickshaw, her husband's income would increase and she could better look after her children. 

Razia seems very happy over this honorable act and says thanks to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy her husband a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Mizhgona

texts.ru: Мижгоне 18 лет. Она не замужем. Мижгона успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Педагогический Университет. Она учится на хорошо и отлично. Мижгона любит читать классическую литературу и часто посещает библиотеку. В свободное время она помогает маме по домохозяйству. Мижгона мечтает в будущем стать хорошим педагогом и служить своей родине. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mizhgona is 18 years old. She is not married. Mizhgona successfully graduated from high school and enrolled in the Tajik Pedagogical University. She gets very good grades. Mizhgona likes to read classical literature and often visits the library. In her spare time, she helps her mother at home. Mizhgona dreams of one day becoming a good teacher and serving her country. She is asking for a loan to pay tuition. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay university tuition

loans.name: Amílcar Efraín

texts.es: Don Amílcar, tiene 57 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en la Masica, Atlántida. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, pero hace 6 años que decidió establecer una pulpería, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, huevos, golosinas, sandalias, pan, abarrotes etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y le ayuda su esposa. Ha solicitado varios prestamos a ODEF para mantener activo el negocio. Actualmente solicita otro de 8,500 lempiras para surtir con productos como granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, huevos, golosinas, lácteos etc. y así podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El objetivo es ayudar a la familia mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Amilcar is 57 years old, married, and has two children who live with him in Masica, Atlantida. He has always worked in commerce, but six years ago, he decided to start a grocery store where he sells consumer staples such as staple grains, dairy products, cold cuts, meat, eggs, snacks, sandals, bread, groceries, etc. The store is located in his house and his wife helps him. He has requested several loans from Odef to keep his business going. Currently, he is requesting 8,500 Honduran lempiras to restock with products such as staple grains, meat, cold cuts, eggs, snacks, dairy products, etc. That way, he will be able to meet the demand of his customers. His goal is to help his family and better their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat, cold cuts, eggs, snacks, dairy products, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a poor, but hardworking woman, age 33, living in Lahore, Pakistan.
 
The living standard of her house is not good; she wants to enhance the livelihood so she can provide better facilities and education to her children. She always remains depressed about how to change their living standard, and what types of strategy should be adopted so she can bring positive change into her family’s life.
 
Her husband provides sheltering services to under constructed houses, and she wants to invest all of her savings for the establishment of the current business. This is the reason she is taking a loan for more investment, so she can grow the business.
 
Rukhsana requested a loan so that she can invest more money in the current business.  She hopes that through the loan amount, her husband would be able to buy bamboos, planks, irons plates and nails.

Rukhsana praises and thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bamboos, planks, nails, and iron sheets for sheltering work.

loans.name: Sithorn's Group

texts.en:
38 years of age, Sihtorn is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.

She is a mother of four children. She and her husband earn a living through selling Khmer noodle and rice soup. They have been in this business for 10 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 24,000 per day from the current business, and are able to save about KHR 14,000 each day for the future.
 
This is the fifth loan for Sithorn with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy spices for making soup. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy spices for making Khmer noodle and rice soup.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sokha is 28 years old and married with three dependent children, one of whom is in school.

For several years, she and her husband have been farming rice as a primary source of family income to make a living, and they can earn about KHR 26,000 per day, and manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Sokha is just with VisionFund this cycle, and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokha is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production and make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Santa Lucrecia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucrecia es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 13 personas, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con el objetivo de ganar su propio dinero y brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una colonia donde las principales actividades económicas son el comercio y la ganadería. 
Doña Leticia es uno de los miembros; ella comenta que se unió a este grupo ya que quería tener la oportunidad de recibir un crédito e iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y así tener una entrada extra de dinero. 
Doña Leticia se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa de cama, manteles y cortinas, ella dice que se inclinó por esta actividad ya que deja buenas ganancias y la competencia es poca lo cual aumenta sus probabilidades de ventas. Normalmente, ella ofrece sus productos casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de las colonias de su municipio, como ya tiene 2 años de experiencia, en ocasiones la gente la busca y le hacen pedidos. Ella está muy contenta con su negocio ya que no sólo es su fuente de empleo sino que le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Un crédito de VisionFund y Kiva le ayudará a invertir en la compra de sábanas, cobijas, edredones, colchas, cortinas y manteles para continuar con sus ventas. Leticia mencionó que le gustaría emplear sus ganancias en la compra de un ropero y en seguir invirtiendo a su negocio. 

Los demás integrantes son:
Maribel venta de comida 
Roxana venta de cosméticos 
Alicia venta de quesos, totopos y tortillas
Teresa venta de artículos para el hogar 
Yolanda venta de perfumes
Julia venta de perfumes
Tomás venta de periódico
José Antonio venta de carne 
Liliana venta de cosméticos 
María Eugenia venta de refrescos 
Leticia M. venta de tacos 
Verónica venta de cosméticos
texts.en:
Santa Lucrecia is the name of a group made up of 13 people. Each member carries out an economic activity with the objective of earning their own money and offering their family a better quality of life. This group is located in a neighbourhood where the main economic activities are trade and ranching.
