Ivonne’s twenty-four years of teaching experience has helped her get her son ahead.  Recently, she requested a loan to improve her home, her kitchen in particular.  She installed nice tiles and constructed a covered porch and laundry area.  She travels with her son to Managua for his medical appointments. 

Her dream is to continue supporting her son through each stage of his life so that he becomes a successful professional, ensure that her son has monthly medical exams to follow-up his illness, and to gradually repair her home to improve her quality of life. 
 
Previously, she received a loan from Pana that allowed her to install a ceiling in her home, and pay for a medical check-up for her small and only son, who is her reason for living

loans.use: To build a kitchen and area to wash clothes

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He started his career at a very young age working as a mechanic. He works at his own garage serving customers with his professional skills. He is specialized at repairing motorcycles. Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the needed mechanical supplies to be able to enhance his repairs. This is his first Kiva loan and we note that Mahmoud is very motivated to achieve what he is intending for and he is sure that he will gain good profits and live in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase the needed mechanical supplies

loans.name: Jhohattan Omar

texts.es: Jhohattan de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su madre y su hermana en casa propia. El se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce, es un negocio familiar, trabaja todos los días junto a su madre y hermana para lograr el sustento diario; Jhohattan es un joven emprendedor, capaz y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su vivienda está ubicada a las afueras de la ciudad y necesita realizar algunos cambios, desea poner puertas y ventanas con balcón porque son más seguras quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible, porque por el momento solo las cubren con laminas, pero debido a su condición económica no posee de capital que lo respalde para la compra de los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar puertas de hierro y ventanas con balcón. Jhohattan está muy contento con la ayuda y se siente comprometido a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Jhohattan is twenty-two years old and in his own house with his mother and sister.  He makes and sells sweet breads.  It is a family business - he works every day with his mother and sister to support their cost of living.


Jhohattan is a young entrepreneur, capable and willing to move out ahead.  His house is located in the suburbs of the city and needs some changes.  He wants to install doors and windows with iron grilles because they are safer.  He wants to start work as soon as possible because for the time-being they are just covered with pieces of metal.  However, because of the economic condition he doesn't have the capital to which would enable him to buy the materials.  Therefore, he's requesting a loan from FUSAI which would allow him to buy doors and windows with metal grilles.  Jhonattan is very happy with the help and feels committed to pay the debt.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows with iron grilles

loans.name: Sadiqan

texts.en:
Sadiqan is aged 55. She is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Her daughters are married and living at their homes happily. Her husband is an old man, now he does not participate in household expenses. 

Her elder son supports the whole family. He is responsible for all expenses and utility bills. He is a hardworking and zealous young man. He owns a general store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is unmarried and she wants to arrange a marriage for him.

She wants her younger son to also start this business in another place so that he could also become a person who earns. Her son has hired a shop but does not have money to buy inventory to run a general store. Therefore, Sadiqan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy the stock of inventory such as pulses, flour, sugar, biscuits, rice etc. She hopes that her younger son will understand his responsibilities toward his family and carry on his business as her elder son is doing.

Sadiqan says thank you to Kiva and hopes that the lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida manages a variety store, eatery and engaged herself into direct selling business. She has run her variety store since 2002 up to now. Lida is separated having two grown up children. Since 1990 she stands as both father and mother to her two children. Despite her situation as single parent, Lida didn't stop believing that someday she could be a better entreprenuer someday.

Lida would like to ask for a loan of PHP7,000 allows her to purchase school supplies and necessary stocks of grocery items for her variety store. She believes that her hard work and additional capital would help make her dreams possible. So she's looking forward for approval of her requested loan. In this way, she could sustain her family needs and somehow obtain better profit which will serve as her savings for her emergency purposes when she got weak.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and necessary stocks of grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. In 2007, he decided to open a communication shop where he sells a wide variety of mobiles and related accessories. Today, and with the aim to support his business, Ahmad is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to implement a UPS system at his store. In that way, he will pay less for electricity and therefore will be able to collect more money and live in better conditions. As for his future plans, Ahmad is seeking to open a new branch of his shop and will maybe sell products other than mobiles.

loans.use: to implement a UPS system

loans.name: Sithou's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sithou is 28 years old and married. She has three children who are still in school. She is a rice farmer and she also plants cassava. She has been in this business for several years, earning about KHR 45,000 per day, and is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.
 
Sithou is just with VisionFund this cycle and she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice and cassava healthily and fruitfully and also hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha, a mother of three children, is a resident from the Sangke district of Battambang province. To stablize their living condition, she and her husband work for others for a fee as their main source of income. This business has returned her family about 16,700 KHR. This is the first loan for Sokha’s group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group loan is 1,000,000 KHR. Sokha, whose loan portion is 300,000 KHR and is the group leader, will spend her loan to buy two pigs for raising for extra income. She hopes that she can gain a good income from this business so that she can expand this business on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy two pigs for raising for extra income

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana Dilia es una joven de 27 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, en un estado civil en unión libre, madre de 1 hijo el cual está recién nacido. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el cuarto grado ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarle para que ella pudiese seguir estudiando. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que en su familia es una tradición que viene de generación en generación. En compañía de su conyugue diariamente se dirigen hasta sus cultivos de café caminando por 20 minutos los cuales son propios gracias a una herencia familiar.

Ella actualmente ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual pretende comprar fertilizantes y abonos con lo que ayudaran mediante la aplicación de estos insumos a mantener limpio sus cultivos de café siendo esta su única actividad económica de ingreso para su familia.

Sus metas son los de poder cultivar una mejor y mayor variedad de café, que sea competitiva en el mercado por su calidad y por su sabor como el borbone entre otros que son de gran éxito en el mercado. Sus sueños son los de poder mejorar la condición de vida de su familia y seguir adelante con cada uno de los proyectos que tiene para triunfar en la vida teniendo como prioridad la educación de su hijo y el fortalecimiento del patrimonio.
texts.en:
Ana Dilia is 27 years old and in a common-law marriage. She is a farmer and a homemaker, and she has one newborn son. Ana Dilia finished the fourth grade, but she was unable to stay in school because her parents did not have enough money. Her parents taught her how to work the land at a very young age, maintaining the family tradition of farming, which has been passed on for generations. Every day, Ana Dilia and her husband walk 20 minutes to reach their fields, which they own thanks to a family inheritance.  

Ana Dilia is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy fertilizers and manure to keep her coffee crops well-maintained. She says that coffee growing is her family’s only source of income. Ana Dilia says that her goal is to improve her coffee and to grow more varieties. She hopes that her coffee will compete in the marketplace, like Borbone and other successful varieties, because of its quality and flavor. Ana Dilia dreams to improve her family’s quality of life and to move ahead with her plans to be successful. She says that her priorities are her son’s education and strengthening her family’s legacy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure to keep her coffee crops well-maintained

loans.name: Veronica Lissette

texts.es: Verónica Lissette de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos uno de 11 años y el otro de 10 años en casa propia. Ella posee un molino de nixtamal y trabaja todos los días en el negocio, además su esposo es empleado y con eso le ayuda a completar los gastos del hogar; Verónica es una mujer joven, audaz y muy capaz de salir adelante con su familia quiere lo mejor para ellos, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural y el piso de es de tierra, necesita encementar para evitar el polvo y mantener más limpio para sus hijos; no posee de fondos económicos para cubrir los gastos de materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, arena y grava. Verónica Lissette está muy alegre con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Verónica Lissette is 29 years old and lives with her spouse and their 2 children, who are 11 and 10 years old, in a house that they own.  She owns a corn mill and works there everyday.  Her husband is also employed, and helps her to cover their household expenses.  Verónica is a bold, young woman who is very capable of pulling her family ahead, and wants the best for them.  

Her home is located in a rural area and has a dirt floor.  In order to avoid dust and keep it cleaner, she must make a concrete floor.  She does not have the necessary funds to cover the cost of the materials, which is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI that will allow her to purchase cement, sand and gravel.  Verónica Lissette is very grateful for the help and is committed to repaying her debt.

loans.use: purcahse cement, sand and gravel

loans.name: Sophany's Group

texts.en:
Sophany, 31, is married with three children residing in a rural village of the Kandieng district of Pursat province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for 11 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 54,000 per day and can save about KHR 40,000 each day for their future needs. 

Sophany is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en: Sambo is a 55-year-old mother of four children residing in Battambang province. Her main sources of income are from raising chickens and trading recycled items. Sambo and her joint borrower, in a group of two, are new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they are seeking a loan of 900,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more chickens to raise and more recycled items to resell. She hopes that both businesses will run smoothly so she can gain a good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and more recycled items

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Som, 51 years old and a widow, is a grocery seller living in Battambang province. After several years of involvement in her current business, she is able to earn up to 13,600 KHR per day.  This is the first micro loan for Som with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. She and her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her business on time and gain a high income to sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Начинающего бизнесмена зовут Нурулло, ему 40 лет, он проживает в районе Фархор на юге страны. Нурулло женат и имеет четверых детей школьного возраста. Недавно он купил помещение для магазина и хочет провести в нем ремонт. Здание является абсолютно без ремонта, даже стены не закончены. Нурулло знал, что ему придется нелегко и за мечтой о продуктовом магазине придется побороться и вложить немало усилий. Нурулло зная об этом, все равно купил помещение. В данный момент он нигде не работает и все свое время и внимание он тратит на ремонт. Нурулло просит кредит, чтобы закончить ремонт и закупить продукты питания. Он с нетерпением ждет дня открытия своего нового магазина продуктов питания в районе Фархор. Благодаря кредиту у него будет доходный бизнес и финансовое положение семьи улучшится.
texts.en:
This novice businessman is called Nurullo. He is 40 years old and lives in the Farkhor region in the south of the country. Nurullo is married and has four children of school age. 

Not long ago, Nurullo purchased premises for a store and would like to carry out renovation on them. The building is completely unrenovated, even the walls are not finished. Nurullo knew that it would not be easy for him and that he would have to fight for his dream of a grocery store, and put in a lot of effort. Knowing this, Nurullo still purchased the premises. Currently he does not work anywhere and spends all his time and attention on the renovation. 

Nurullo requests a loan in order to finish the renovation and purchase food products. He eagerly awaits the opening day of his new grocery store in the Farkhor region. Thanks to the loan he has a profitable business and the financial situation of the family is improving.

loans.use: to renovate premises and purchase food products to open a store

loans.name: Soben

texts.en: Soben is a citizen of a rural area located in Takeo Province’s Koh Andeth District where crop farming.  She is married and is the 53-year-old mother of six children, three of whom are still in school. To feed her household, she earns a living through farming rice. She is able to earn up to US$20 per day from this business in which she has been working for 24 years. She can manage to save only US$4 each day for future needs. Soben has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for another loan for her son’s tuition fees for a four-year bachelor's degree majoring in General Management. This loan will enable her to send her son to university and to keep him there. Soben hopes that her children will have a good and bright future.

loans.use: for pay her son’s tuition fees

loans.name: William

texts.es: William de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia. El se dedica a la agricultura siembra frijol y maíz, su esposa trabaja en una zapatería y entre los dos logran llevar el sustento diario al hogar; William es un hombre decidido, muy capaz y responsable siempre está buscando oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante, su vivienda se encuentra en las afueras de la ciudad y desde hace algún tiempo quiere realizarle algunas reparaciones, necesita cambiar la lamina del techo porque esta picada y se filtra el agua, espera realizarlo lo más pronto posible ya que en esta época de lluvia resulta incomodo; no posee capital para la compra de materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada. William está muy contento con la ayuda y espera corresponder con los pagos.
texts.en:
William, 56 years old, lives with his partner in their own home.  He works in agriculture, planting beans and corn.  His wife, works in a shoe shop and between them, they are able to manage their daily household expenses.  William is a very capable, responsible and determined man who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead. 

His home is located on the outskirts of the city, and for sometime he has wanted to do some repairs on it.  He needs to change the metal sheets on the roof because it has holes in it that let water through.  He hopes to make the repairs as soon as possible since it is now the rainy season and it is an inconvenience.  He does not have the funds to purchase the materials which is why he is seeking a loan from FUSAI that will allow him to purchase the galvanized metal sheets.  William is very grateful for the help and expects to make the payments.

loans.use: purchase galvanized metal sheets.

loans.name: Savon

texts.en: Savon is 51 years old and a mother of six children. She lives in the Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She struggles to make a living. She sells dessert and her husband works at a construction site. Now, she is in need of working capital to support one of her sons who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree specializing in Management. Therefore, she is applying for an education loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as a first time borrower to pay for her son's tuition fee. She hopes that this financial support will help her son to pay more attention to his studies so that he can get a good job after graduation and support the family.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Kiran's Group

texts.en:
Kiran is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a depot in which he sells the Holy Quran. Her husband’s depot is located near a mosque in which the children learn and recite the Quran. He offers the Holy Quran from various companies, translated from Arabic to Urdu.

He wants to grow his business and buy more Holy Qurans to offer but does not have sufficient capital to purchase them. Therefore, Kiran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy more copies of the Holy Quran and easily increase his income. 

She is very glad to be taking this loan and praises the lenders who are taking an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: To buy more copies of the Holy Quran for resale.

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru: Асылкан 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. У Асылкан - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Асылкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Асылкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 1 лошадь, 10 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асылкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Асылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Asylkan is 55 years old, married and together with her husband is raising 7 children.  Asylkan has a university education.  The primary income to her family comes from Asylkan's cattle raising business, which she started 25 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 400 KGS.  Thanks to Asylkan's hard work, her farm currently has 6 milking cows, one horse and 10 goats.  Her monthly income is 17,000 KGS.   

In order to expand her business, Asylkan has applied for a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners, for the amount of 40,000 KGS.  She is planning to use this loan to purchase calves in order to increase her head count.  Part of the profit from her business, Asylkan is planning to invest into purchasing additional cattle, and the other part she is planning to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Magola Elsira

texts.es:
Magola, mujer emprendedora de 49 años de edad oriunda de Saquisilí, cantón perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi, de la República del Ecuador,  este sector es muy reconocido por la  comercialización de granos secos, Magola es divorciada tiene un hijo de 21 años quien ya está casado y vive en la ciudad de Latacunga, visita a su madre todos los días.
Magola se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de Sigchos, zona alejada de la ciudad, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien toda su vida se dedicó a esta actividad, y fue Magola quien heredó. Los días que sale a la feria son los lunes y domingos, el resto de la semana cuida de animales menores como son pollos, cuyes y cerdos, los mismos que tiene en su casa.
Por la situación económica tiene que salir a trabajar, ya que ella no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de su hijo, desde muy niña trabajó en el campo con sus padres, hoy Magola cuida de su madre ya que su padre murió.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en hortalizas y verduras ya que sus clientes le han solicitado variedad en sus productos, tiene mucha demanda ya que este sector es muy comercial, tiene dificultad al momento de trasladar su producto, es por esto que no puede ir más seguido a expender sus productos, pero con el ingreso de los animalitos ha podido salir adelante y solventar sus necesidades y las de su ya anciana madre. 
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una buena salud y trabajo para seguir cuidando de su madre, ya que no cuenta con nadie más.
Magola quiere extender y hacer llegar un sincero agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y Kiva por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder crecer en su negocio y mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magola, 49, is an enterprising woman from Saquisilí, a canton in the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador.  This area is very well known for selling dry grains.  Magola's divorced and has a son, 21, who's already married and lives in the city of Latacunga.  He visits his mother every day.

Magola makes a living selling fruit in the market in Sigchos, an area away from the city.  She learned this business from her mother, who did this work her entire life and Magola inherited it from her.  She goes to market on Monday and Sunday; the rest of the week she stays at home taking care of small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

She has to go out and work because of her financial situation, as she doesn't have the support of her son's father.  She worked in the field with her parents from a very young age.  Now Magola takes care of her mother because her father died.

Magola's requesting the loan to invest in fruits and vegetables because her customers have asked for variety.  She has a lot of demand because this is a commercial area.  It's difficult for her right now to transport her products, which is why she can't go more often to sell her products.  With the income from her small animals, though, she has been able to get ahead and pay for her own necessities and those of her mother, who's a senior citizen.

Her biggest dream is to be healthy and have a job so she can keep on taking care of her mother, who doesn't have anyone else.

Magola wants to extend her sincere thanks to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for this opportunity to be able to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marvorid

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Марворид.  Ей 24 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 1 года занимается скотоводством. Она начала свой бизнес с 2 голов скота. Она постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A kind person who always strives to improve her living situation and hopes for a brighter future is in need of financial support.  Her name is Marvorid.  She is 24 years old, married and is raising two children.  Marvorid lives in the countryside, which offers her a great opportunity to expand her business of raising cattle.  She has been working in this field for more than a year.  She started her endeavor with two heads of cattle and slowly grew her farm.  

Currently, she is planning to make repairs on her house.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase building materials such as cement and lumber.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and lumber to make repairs on her house

loans.name: Mosioma

texts.en:
Mosioma is a 27-year-old, very hardworking gentleman who supports his two sisters, of whom one is in high school and the other in college. He has been running a car wash business in Narok town for the last seven months which earns him a monthly income of about 35,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings).

He learned about KADET from some credit team members who held a marketing campaign in town. He has been advanced a first loan of 50,000 KES which will enable him to acquire an electric cash washer and a generator. This will give him the much needed cutting edge in the car wash business, as Narok town is very dusty. He will use the proceeds to assist his family to meet their basic needs as well assisting in paying fees for his sisters' schooling.

His hope is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a car wash machine

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo appreciates Kiva for her previous loan that improved her living standards. She managed to add more stock in her grocery store. She is requesting for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase vegetables, potatoes, onions and tomatoes for resale. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their loan services.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes, onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province, Sarorn is 48 years old and a widowed mother of four children. As a single mother who supports her children alone, she trades recycled items as the core income generating business. 

Sarorn is in her first cycle of loans with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Nowadays, one of her sons needs to pursue a Bachelor degree specializing in Engineering. Therefore, she has applied for an education loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to pay for two years tuition for her son. 

She hopes that she can support her son's education on time so that her son can pay more attention in his academic work and get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay for two years tuition for her son

loans.name: Chaya

texts.en:
Chaya is a young mother of one little boy, who strives for a living via rice cropping on two hectares of farmland, with the support of her husband. 

Chaya has been involved in her current business for three years. Chaya has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. With this loan, she is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to boost her crop yield on time and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es:
Rosa Lilian es una mujer con 32 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante acompañada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales son apoyo con las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: limpieza, corte, abono y fertilización en sus cultivos de café. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleto el cual pudo cursar hasta el tercer grado pero no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarla. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado al cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia hasta hoy en día siendo este el único sustento ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace muchos años. La tierra que en familia trabajan fue es propia gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio realizado por ellos la cual está ubicada a una distancia caminando de 20 minutos de su casa de habitación. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, foliares, entre otros para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus metas son poder cultivar más plantas de café para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos para su familia ya que por medio de esto ellos podrán seguir invirtiendo en sus cultivos y agrandar poco a poco sus cosechas. Las ganancias son para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y para seguir invirtiendo en su tierra y apoyarles con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa Lilian is 32 years old and in a relationship. She is described as a fighter who has an entrepreneurial spirit and a strong desire to better herself and get ahead. Rosa Lilian has five children, all of whom help her with the jobs to maintain their coffee crop such as weeding, pruning, fertilizing and applying manure. She finished the third grade, but was unable to stay in school because her parents did not have enough money. Rosa Lilian’s parents taught her how to work the land at a very young age, and she has worked growing coffee since childhood. Her family continues growing coffee today, and she says that it is their only source of income. Rosa Lilian says that they own the fields where they grow their coffee, thanks to their sacrifices and hard work. Their fields are a 20-minute walk from their home. 

Rosa Lilian is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, leaf fertilizer and other supplies to maintain her coffee crop. She hopes to have a healthy and profitable harvest so that she can make a good income and continue to invest in her coffee crop. Her goal is to plant more coffee so that she can improve her family’s income and, little by little, increase the size of her harvest. Rosa Lilian says that her profits will help to ensure her children’s future and will allow her to give them an education and continue to invest in her crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, leaf fertilizer and other supplies to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Chitra's Group

texts.en:
Chitra is a young mother of two little kids. She and the rest of her family reside in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province where she does her agribusiness - rice farming, as the main source of her income. 

She has been in this business now for five years. Chitra and her co-borrower are not first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as they have been with VisionFund for at least three past cycles already, and have repaid back with success. The past loans have enabled her to improve her lifestyle.

Now, Chitra and her joint borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, insecticide and to pay for labor for her farmland. She hopes that she can produce a good yield next harvest better than before and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor for her farmland

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 38 years, married to Felista and together they are blessed with one child. Christopher has been selling fish for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to meet the needs of his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET. He will use the loan to open a hotel. 

With the anticipated profit he will repay his loan with KADET. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and start farming in the future.

loans.use: To open a hotel.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old from Olkalou. He is divorced, but supports his three children aged 20, 17 and 14 years old.

He is a farmer who practices mixed farming and has been into this business for the last 25 years. To enable him purchase a heifer, he has applied for his seventh loan of Ksh 90,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is Ksh 14,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profit from his expanded business to pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd., as well as to educate his children.

In the future, John's dreams and hopes is that he will buy a piece of land and for his children to attain the highest possible level of education.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and animal feeds

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old from Nyahururu. He owns a hardware store which has been in operation for the last five years. 

In his business, he sells things like steel nails, mirrors, iron sheets and paint. Since he needs to replenish the stock of these items and others, he has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd.

His monthly income is KES 20,000 and his intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his three children, ages 16, 10 and 2 years old. He will use the remaining profits to start a business for Zipporah, his spouse, who is currently a housewife.

Samuel's hopes and dreams are that in the future, he will own the biggest hardware store in his town.

loans.use: To replenish his stock of mirrors, steel nails, iron sheets and paint for his hardware store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 51 years old, married to Michael and they are blessed with five children, including twins age 25. She runs a grocery business in Kapsabet. This has been her income-generating business for the last four years. She earns an average monthly income of KES 30,000. She plans to use the loan of KES 90,000 to purchase a motorbike. She will use the profits from her business to start poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
In the town of Nyahururu, you will find a very hardworking lady known as Lucy. She is a 37-year-old widow and a mother to two children, age 17 and 14 years old, both in school.

She has a general store where she sells items such as sugar, cooking fat, flour, rice, salt and soft drinks. She has been running this business for the last four years, and to add more stocks of these items, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Lucy's income per month is KES 12,000, and she intends to use profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

In the future, she hopes to open a super market.

loans.use: to add more stocks to her general store, e.g. sugar, cooking fat, flour, rice, salt and soft drinks like sodas.

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru: Нурия 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Нурии- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нурия занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 10 овец и 2 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины для сына.
texts.en: Nuriya is 52 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Nuriya has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 13 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nuriya's hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows, 2 calves, 10 sheep and 2 goats. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Nuriya requested a loan in the amount of 105,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount. Nuriya plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to purchase a car for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is 56 years old, married and a mother of three children. She also has three grandchildren. Gulzar loves her grandchildren very much and tries to provide them with a good upbringing. Her husband is pensioner and now he leads the funeral ceremony in the village.
Gulzar is a kind and hard-working woman. According to her neighbors' opinion, she is very outgoing and welcoming. She is engaged in buying and selling cattle and milk products. Her relatives help her with this because her health won't allow her to fatten up livestock and resell it by herself. Gulzar came to VFAC for the loan of 1600 AZN to pay for her surgery. She hopes that the organization will help her with financial support.

loans.use: pay for a surgery.

loans.name: Nun's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Nun is 39 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children are still in school and count on her. She earns a living through rice farming as a main source of her income. She also grows vegetables such as corn, beans and cucumbers. Having been in this business for nine years, she is able to earn about 38,700 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. Nun’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. She is a third loan client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and has completely repaid back the previous loans. The past loan has helped her to expand her farmland. She and her group members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a cow for her farming and also buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to double her cash crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy a cow and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, uno de 14 años y otro de 12 años en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y también vende pupusas, trabaja todos los días en su negocio para ganarse honradamente el sustento diario; María es una mujer emprendedora y muy audaz siempre está buscando lo mejor para su familia; en su vivienda desde hace algunos meses se decidió a realizar algunas reparaciones en el techo porque esta deteriorado, necesita cambiar la lamina porque esta picada y se filtra el agua; espera empezar con el trabajo lo más rápido posible, pero debido a sus bajos recursos no puede costear el gasto de materiales  por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lámina galvanizada. María del Carmen está muy contenta con la ayuda y espera corresponder con los pagos establecidos.
texts.en: María del Carmen is forty three year old. She lives with her life's companion and their two children, aged 14 and 12, in the house they own. She sells fruit and pupusas. She works every day at her business to earn her daily pay in an honorable way. María is an enterprising and very daring woman. She is always seeking the best for her family. A few months ago she decided to make some repairs on the roof on her house because it has deteriorated. She needs to change the sheeting because it has holes in it and water leaks in. She hopes to start the work as soon as possible, but due to her low resources   she can't afford to pay for the materials. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy galvanized metal sheeting. María del Carmen is very happy with the help and expects to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting.

loans.name: Benigna Francisca

texts.es: Benigna Francisca de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a sus hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y también por las tardes vende empanadas, además sus hijos le ayudan a completar los gastos del hogar; Benigna es una mujer muy humilde y responsable lo mas importante en su vida es la familia y su bienestar; por eso desde hace alguna semanas quiere realizar reparaciones en el techo de su vivienda porque esta picado y eso les genera inseguridad además en esta época de lluvia se filtra el agua; no posee fondos económicos para costear los gastos por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada. Benigna está muy agradecida con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en: Benigna Francisca, 51, lives with her adult children.  She works raising and selling chickens and in the evening sells turnovers.  Her children help her pay household expenses.  Benigna’s a very humble, responsible woman.  What’s most important to her in life is her family and their well-being.  Because of this, she’s been repairing her roof the last few weeks because it’s damaged which reduces safety and in the rainy season water leaks in.  She does not have enough funds to cover the cost which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting.  Benigna’s very grateful for the support and committed to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Xiomara Raquel

texts.es: Xiomara Raquel de veintidós años de edad vive junto a sus padres, ella se dedica a los oficios varios lava, plancha y además vende productos plásticos, con eso logra el sustento diario; Xiomara es una mujer muy capaz, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su vivienda está un poco deteriorada y necesita cambiar la lamina del techo por una más resistente porque esta picada y en esta época de lluvia se filtra el agua; pero no posee el capital para costear los gastos de materiales, por eso se decidió a solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada.  Xiomara Raquel está muy contenta con la ayuda y asegura cancelar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: Xiomara Raquel, 22, lives with her parents.  She works doing various jobs: she washes, irons and also sells plastic products.  She earns daily sustenance this way.  Xiomara is a very capable, enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her house is a bit deteriorated and she needs to replace the roof sheeting with a more resistant one because it’s rotted away and water leaks in during the rainy season.  She does not have capital to cover the cost of materials which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets.  Xiomara Raquel is very happy with the support and assures that she’ll make the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 35 years old, married to Beatrice, and supports a family of five people. He is in the transport business using donkeys to supply water. He is served by Kadet Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 18,000. He has borrowed a loan of Kshs. 60,000 which he will use to purchase a dairy cow. With the anticipated profits from his transport business he plans to buy a plot of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Patricia Rosalia

texts.es: La   Sra. Patricia tiene 28 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Patricia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la  Sra. Patricia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, la  Sra. Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Patricia is 28 years old. She makes a living through the sale of a variety of convenience store items, such as groceries, and a variety of articles from her neighborhood store.

This loan is her first sequence within the institution. Patricia is going to use this loan to purchase a variety of groceries to supply her business, such as rice, noodles, flour, and sugar, wholesale, and in this way provide a variety of products to her customers. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Patricia is going to use those benefits to continue purchasing products and therefore improve her income. 

Patricia is a very hard-working person. She is happy and thankful to the institution for the support provided in the awarding of the loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He is the main income source for the family. He has owned a small shop since 2010 where he provides customers with Nescafe and Hubble-Bubble (hookah). 

In parallel, he started working at a local company a year ago. In Lebanon, it’s very common to have multiple jobs to afford the high costs of living. With his youth loan requested from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase Hubble-Bubble products and supplies. 

In the future, he plans to turn his shop into a small restaurant and serve different plates and delicious ones.

loans.use: purchase Hubble-Bubble (hookah) products and supplies.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Gregoria, tiene 37 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Gregoria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada al por mayor ya que se acerca la época de calor, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Gregoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar mercadería, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Gregoria se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 37, sells seasonal clothing.  She sells her goods in a stand located in Batallas.  This is her first loan with the institution and Gregoria will use it to buy seasonal clothes at wholesale since the hot season is approaching and she has many pending orders and sales increase then.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of capital.  

The business challenge Gregoria faces is daily competition.  She will use profits to buy merchandise.  Her wish for her business is to have it well-stocked with assorted merchandise to offer a variety of products to her customers.  Gregoria feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because it allows her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 31 years old and comes from Nyahururu. He is married to Nyawira who is a housewife and they have one child aged three years old.

He is in the transport industry using his motorcycle to carry milk for the neighbors to the dairy shops, this is a business he has been carrying out for the last four years. Owing to the large number of customers that Francis has, he feels that he needs to buy an additional motorcycle and to enable him to do this, he has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd of Kshs. 85,000.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 20,000 and he plans to use profits from his expanded business to buy a motor rickshaw.

In the future, Francis hopes to buy a pick-up so as to be more effective and efficient in his transport services.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for use in transportation of milk to the dairy shops

loans.name: Fraciah

texts.en:
Fraciah is a very hardworking lady from Nyahururu. She is 45 years old, married to John who is a businessman,  and she is mother of two children aged 24 and 20 years old.

Her main occupation is farming, a business she has been carrying out for the last ten years. She feels that she has been spending a lot of time fetching firewood thus not being able to spend enough time in her farm, and as a result of this she has applied for her second loan of Kshs. 19,354 from Kadet Ltd which will enable her to buy a gas cooker complete with a burner and a gas cylinder to ensure that less time is spent in preparation of meals thereby increasing time spent on the farm.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 10,000 and she intends to use profits from her expanded business to educate her children and the remaining sum to be used to purchase a plot of land.

She hopes to spend her future in prosperity.

loans.use: To buy a gas cooker complete with  a burner and gas cylinder

loans.name: Akonkwa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukiti est une commerçante et membre d’une association  d’affaires  «  Akonkwa », jeune femme célibataire, âgée  de 25 ans et responsable des deux enfants sous  sa  tutelle. Elle est vendeuse  des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter  2 sacs de farine formants, un sac de riz, les allumettes, savons, un sac de sucre, des bonbons, biscuits, lait Nido, lotion de beauté, etc., pour accroitre son entreprise.  Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds propre reçu de ses parents. Dans l’avenir,  elle rêve devenir une grande femme d’affaires et acheter une voiture. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The client Mukiti is a shopkeeper and member of the business association Akonkwa. She is a young single woman, 25 years old and responsible for the two children under her supervision. She sells a variety of items and is a member of a boutique. She requested a loan from Hekima. She is going to buy 2 bags of wheat flour, one bag of rice, matches, soaps, one bag of sugar, candies, cookies, Nido milk, beauty lotions, etc. to grow her business. She started with her own funds received from her parents. In the future, she dreams of becoming a great business woman and buying a car. Thus, she thanks Hekima for supporting female entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of wheat flour, one bag of rice, matches, soaps, one bag of sugar, candies, cookies, Nido milk, beauty lotions, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
A villager from the Ou Reang Ov district, Dy is 28 years old and a mother of two daughters; both of them are still in school and relay on her. She does rice farming and pig-raising, which are the main sources of her family income. She has been with this business for several years.

Dy has been with VisionFund for the past two cycles, which she has successfully repaid. With the past loan, she has supported her business. Now she is seeking a new loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy piglets for her pig-raising and purchase pig feed for her pig nutrition. 

She hopes to make a good income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed for her pig raising and nutrition.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Kompoy's Group

texts.en:
Kompoy, a citizen of Battambang province, Sangke district, is 30 years old and a married mother of two sons. One of them is in school while the other one is too young for school. To struggle for a living, she and her husband have worked as paid workers for 10 years. To supplement the family income, her husband also catches fish for sale. The current business has returned her about 19,400 KHR per day to face the daily expenses. 

Kompoy is a fourth cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely repaid prior loans. The previous loans have helped her to cover the needs in her family and she can keep her son in school. Now she has formed a group consisting of two members to apply a loan from VisionFund. She is the leader, and she will use her loan portion to buy more fishing supplies for her husband's business. She hopes to increase her income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeun is 50 years old and married. He is blessed with four children. 

Nowadays, his main source of income is from a cow-raising business, while his wife works for others for a fee to supplement the family’s income. The current business has returned him about 26,000 KHR per day to cover the daily cost of living. 

Now, Chamroeun leads a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy chickens to raise, and chicken feed. 

He hopes that he can increase his income by expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise, and chicken feed

loans.name: Chandy's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province, Chandy is 54 years old and blessed with five children. Her primary source of income is from a beverage-selling business, which she has been involved in for two years. 

This is the fourth microloan for Chandy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her loan to improve her living conditions, and has succeeded in paying back her past loan wisely. 

Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. Chandy will spend her loan to germinate mushrooms for growing and to sell. 

She hopes that she can grow mushrooms healthily, so she can double her income to better expand this business.

loans.use: To germinate mushrooms for growing and to sell.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
A father of two schoolchildren residing in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province, Bun is 43 years old and the only breadwinner in the family who strives for a living via rice crops. He has been involved in his current business for ages. Bun is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has repaid his past loan with success to relieve his family’s burden and support his business better than before. 

Now, Bun is seeking a new loan to pay his son’s tuition fee. His son wants to hold a bachelor's degree specializing in engineering. Bun hopes that this financial support will help his son to pay more attention to his studies and get good grades to obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay his son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana, a sus 40 años de edad, con el ánimo de generar ingresos por cuenta propia para solventar los gastos de su hogar, desea iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de mercancía, desea ofrecer ropa, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros artículos y sus principales clientes serán familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector. La cliente es una mujer activa y emprendedora, tiene un espíritu de superación que la motiva siempre para buscar opciones que le permitan salir adelante. Es por eso que solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertir en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, calzado, accesorios, etc), así podrá dar inicio a su idea de negocio y podrá generar los recursos económicos que necesita para subsistir. Liliana sueña con fortalecer su actividad y lograr que sea rentable para que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable y disfrutar de mejor bienestar y calidad de vida en un futuro cercano, aunque es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar con empeño, disciplina y mucha dedicación para poder disfrutar los frutos de esta nueva labor.
texts.en:
Liliana, 40, aiming at generating income of her own to cover household expenses wants to start her own business selling merchandise.  She wants to sell clothes, accessories and perfumery among other items.  Her main customers will be family members, friends and neighbors from the sector.  

She’s a very active, enterprising woman with a strong drive for self-improvement that motivates her to constantly seek options that will lead to progress which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale (blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, etc.) to start her business and generate the economic resources she needs to subsist.

Liliana dreams with strengthening her activity and make it profitable so that she can have good economic stability and be able to enjoy improved well-being and quality of life in the near future although she’s well-aware that to reach this she must work hard with discipline and much dedication to be able to enjoy the fruits of this new labor.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 28-year-old single mother of one child, who is in school.

She has a business of selling charcoal in Naivasha, which she has operated for seven years.  She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to  purchase a stock of charcoal to sell. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees and buy more stock for her business.

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest charcoal store in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To purchase stock charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 22-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband, who is in the Lebanese army. She has two children who are attending school. 

She has been working as a beautician since 2010. Zeinab works from her home, where she receives her customers. 

With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase beauty products and supplies. 

Zeinab is very satisfied, and seeks to open a formal beauty salon as soon as she can after receiving a new Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year-old widow blessed with three children. She is into the secondhand cloths business in Awasi location, served by KADET Kapsabet office. 

This has been her income-generating business for the last 14 years; she gets an average monthly income of KES 30,000. She plans to use the amount of KES 90,000 borrowed to purchase five bales of secondhand clothes for resale. 

Her dream is to educate her children to the university.

loans.use: to purchase five bales of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 59 years old, married to Francis and is blessed with four children aged between 28 and 37 years old. For the past two years she has raised chickens and earns an average monthly income of 30,000 KES by doing so.

Grace lives in the Awasi region, which is served by KADET’s Kapsabet office. She is applying for a 105,000 KES loan through this office to buy more chicks to raise and then sell in a few months’ time. She will use her profits to expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Tuzobaho Ii Group

texts.fr:
Vestine fait partie du groupe Tuzobaho II et  habite à  Gitega. Elle  a  31 ans et est mariée  à Ferdinand, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  dont  3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de farine de manioc et de maïs  depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son  quatorzième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de maniocs et de maïs à transformer en farine,  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Vestine is part of the group Tuzobaho. She lives in Gitega. She is 31 years old and married to Ferdinand, a shopkeeper. They have 4 children together of whom 3 study.

She has been selling manioc flour and corn for 5 years.

She is on her fourteenth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she receives, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of maniocs and corn to make into flour, to resell to make more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of maniocs and corn to make into flour, to resell to make more.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a widowed woman with three children. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling second-hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

She is requesting for KES 30,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of Ksh.50,000 to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Jennifer Estephany

texts.es:
Jennifer, está casada, no tiene hijos vive solo con su esposo. Desde hace un tiempo debido a la necesidad de generar más ingresos instalo en su casa el negocio de venta de tortillas; sus labores inician a las 9:00 a.m. y finalizan 3:00 p.m., para ella no representa ninguna dificultad su negocio.
Solicita un crédito para comprar maíz y leña; así poder aumentar la productividad de su negocio  y tener la materia prima necesaria para que su producción sea mayor; con las ganancias que tenga pagara su préstamo.
Jennifer desea generar más ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar y tener los recursos para comprar una casa propia que más adelante será el patrimonio que les ofrezcan a los hijos que planean tener.
texts.en:
Jennifer’s married and has no children; she lives just with her husband.  For some time now because of the need to generate more income she set up a tortilla shop at home.  Her work starts at 9am and ends at 3pm.  The business presents no difficulty for her.

She’s asking for a loan to buy corn and firewood to be able to increase production in her business and have larger amounts of raw materials needed for increased production.  She will use profits earned to repay the loan.

Jennifer would like to earn higher income to help her husband with household expenses and to have resources to buy a house of their own later on which will be the estate they’ll provide for the children they plan to have in future.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Maria Felipa

texts.es:
María, tiene mucha demanda en su negocio por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito con el que comprara una plancha para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas. Con el préstamo anterior pudo mejorar la calidad de su producto brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Para ella los ingresos han aumentado, ha podido cancelar las cuotas del crédito, las condiciones de vida son mejores, goza de buena salud y su núcleo familiar se mantiene igual.
texts.en: Demand is high in María’s business which is why she needs to request a new loan to buy a griddle to be able to make a higher amount of tortillas.  She was able to improve the quality of her product and provide better customer service with her previous loan.  Income has increased and she was able to make all her installment payments.  Living conditions are better, she’s in good health and her immediate family remains the same.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make more tortillas.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 30 years old, married to Peter, and they have two children who are in school.

She has a business of selling fruit in Naivasha, which she has been running for six years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd so she can purchase a stock of fruit to sell. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees and expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to own a kiosk to establish a stable business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married with two school-going children. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaisha has operated a Khanga (women wrap cloth) selling business for the past ten years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas(women wrap clothes) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women wrap clothes) for resale

loans.name: Hortensia Magaly

texts.es:
Hortensia, necesita capital para invertir nuevamente en su venta de ropa, comprara ropa para dama y niños (estilos nuevos, variedad de colores y tallas). Fue beneficiada con la oportunidad de un crédito anteriormente con el que amplió la variedad de productos que ofrecía.
Tiene más clientes satisfechos, mejores ingresos, hoy puede brindar una mejor alimentación, educación y salud a su familia.
texts.en: Hortensia needs capital to invest in her clothing sales once again.  She will buy clothes for women and children (new styles, a variety of colors and sizes).  Her previous loan was beneficial for she was able to expand the variety of products she sold.  She has more satisfied customers, higher income and she’s able now to provide her family with better nutrition, education and health.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Thea is 32 years old and married. She and her husband farm rice on six hectares of farmland; their rice crops are the main source of their income. She has farmed for ten years, earning on average 34,700 KHR a day.

Thea is the leader of this two-member group. This will be her fourth loan through VisionFund, while it will be her partner’s fifth. Thea has successfully repaid and used her past loans wisely to upgrade her family’s lifestyle.

Thea is applying for a 1,800,000 KHR loan for her group. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for labor costs on her farm. She hopes to increase her crop’s yield and so her profits to better her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 45 years old and married to Zablon, and they have five children who are in school.

She has a business of selling fruits in Naivasha, which she has been running for thirteen years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to purchase stocks of apples to sell. With anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to become the biggest fruit vendor in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Carolina Lisset

texts.es:
Carolina, necesita capital para comprar blusas femeninas (variedad de estilos, colores y tallas). A ella se le facilito un crédito con el cual surtió su negocio actualizando los productos que ofrecía, dándole como resultado mayores ganancias, clientes nuevos y satisfechos.
Carolina hoy brinda mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, también le ha enseñado a su hija a desempañar su oficio en el tiempo libre.
texts.en: Carolina needs capital to buy women’s blouses (variety of styles, colors and sizes).  She was given a previous loan she used to stock the business with updated items leading to higher profits and new, satisfied customers.  Today, Carolina provides her family with better living conditions and has also taught her daughter how to carry out her occupation in her free time.

loans.use: to buy women's blouses.

loans.name: Chi's Group

texts.en:
Chi, 63, is a resident of Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. Her primary source of income is from half hectare of rice cropping. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years, and now she is able to earn up to 16,600 KHR per day. 

The main challenge for her business is the shortage of working capital to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. To overcome this challenge, she forms a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She has fully repaid back her past loan wisely to uplift her living condition better than before. Now, she is seeking her new loan in order to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee for her farmland. 

She hopes that she can support her agribusiness on time and double her crop yield with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is from Nyahururu. She is 65 years old, single, and the mother of one child, who is 30.

She is a farmer who practices mixed farming, a business she has been operating for the last three years. Hannah has applied for her third loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd to hire laborers to assist with the harvesting of maize, and also with the preparation of land for the next planting season.

Her monthly income at present is Kshs.15,000; she hopes to use the profits realized from her expanded business to build rental houses on a plot she owns. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To hire laborers to assist with the harvesting and prepation of land for the next planting season

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 61 years old, and a hotel owner. She is married to Eric, and together they are blessed with five children. Jane has been running her own hotel for the past year, with a monthly income of ksh 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Jane is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Jane will use the loan to renovate her business and start her own farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will pay school fees for her children, who are in college. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be a successful business lady and a farmer.

loans.use: To renovate her business and start her own farm.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is in her late 20s, married and is the mother of two dependent children. The family lives in Kampong Cham province. Kunthea leads this four-member loan group. This will be the first microloan for Kunthea with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As the leader she is applying for a 1,700,000 KHR loan to be divided among her group members.

Kunthea will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for transplanting costs. She hopes that these investments will result in a better yield and enable her to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for transplanting costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, a married man of four children, is a cattle keeper in a rural area. He keeps cattle for milk, and also to sell at times. The business has helped him to sustain his family demands, but he gets challenged at times of cattle disease, which lead into quarantine; this affects him especially when he has acquired a loan and may not easily pay because he can't make sales during that period. 

However, he thanks Ugafode for the flexibility in the repayment terms, like being allowed to pay quarterly, which helps him to plan.

He will use the loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Анаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 60,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Anarkan is 57, married, and raising 4 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, having started 13 years ago with 60,000 somoni worth of livestock.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her farm currently has 2 dairy cows, 2 calves, and 15 sheep.  Her monthly income is about 8,000 somoni.  To further develop her farm, Anarkan is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners; she hopes to borrow 100,000 somoni to buy calves for her farm, and plans on using any future profits from the loan to continue to buy more livestock for her farm.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Ilse Ivania

texts.es:
Ilse Ivania es una joven de 23 años de edad, emprendedora, luchadora proveniente de una familia humilde y agricultora por generaciones, madre de un hijo el cual tiene 2 años de edad. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria completo por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado por sus padres los cuales han sido un gran ejemplo de respeto y honestidad para ella. Junto a su pareja realizan los diferentes trabajos en el campo como limpieza, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros que ayudan al crecimiento y fortalecimiento del grano. El terreno que ella y su conyugue trabajan es propio el cual adquirieron gracias a una compra y está a una distancia de una hora al cual se trasladan caminando. 

Sus planes para el futuro son los de poder comprar más tierra para el futuro, sembrar una variedad diferente de café, más atractiva, más competitiva en el mercado local y nacional para algún día cumplir sus sueños de exportar a otros países su producto. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que podrá dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café pudiendo aprovechar al máximo esta próxima temporada ya que el café casi esta en su punto de corte.
texts.en:
Ilse Ivania is a 23-year old entrepreneur with a secondary education degree. She is a fighter from a humble family that has farmed for generations. She has a two-year old son and is grateful to her parents for their support. They have been a great example of respect and honesty for her. Together with her partner, she does different jobs in the fields such as cleaning, spreading manure, fertilizer, and leaves, as well as other tasks that help the crops grow strong. The land that she and her spouse work is their own, and was acquired through a purchase. It is about an hour's walk away.

Their plans for the future are to be able to buy more land and to plant a different type of coffee - more attractive, more competitive in the local and national market - so they can one day fulfill their dreams of exporting their product to other countries. Ilse is requesting a loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL for the purchase of agricultural supplies which will support and maintain their coffee crop so they can take full advantage of the next season since harvest time is approaching.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Esy Yanori

texts.es:
Esy tiene 26 años de edad, madre soltera, vive con su hijo y sus padres, quienes le ha apoyado económicamente para el pago de sus estudios universitarios en el Centro Tecnológico, manteniendo un índice académico del 81% actualmente esta cursando su último trimestre de estudios, faltándole solamente  2 clases de su plan de estudio y sus práctica profesional en la carrera de Psicología con Orientación Empresarial.

Se considera una persona responsable, educada, obediente y muy ordenada, cualidades que destaca, adicional a estas una persona perseverante y luchadora, que espera tener mejores oportunidades de superación y es consiente de que debe esforzarse por ofrecerle a su familia y en especial a su hijo un mejor futuro y calidad de vida. Sus planes son concluir su carrera universitaria y continuar su maestría de esta manera lograr uno de su objetivos profesionales.
texts.en:
Esy, 26, is a single mother. She lives with her son and parents, who provide her with financial support to pay for college at the Technology Center. She maintains an academic average of 81%. She is now in her final trimester of school, with only two classes left in her plan of study and her professional practicum in a career of Psychology with an emphasis on Business.

Qualities that stand out about her are being a responsible, educated, obedient, and very organized person. She is also persevering and hard-working. She hopes to have better opportunities to improve and is aware that she has to work hard to offer her family, especially her son, a better future and a better quality of life. She plans to finish school and continue on for a Master's Degree. This will help her reach one of her professional goals.

loans.use: to cover monthly payments and graduation costs from the University.

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en:
Rehmat lives in the Lahore region of Pakistan. She is seeking a loan for her son who has driven a gasoline-powered auto rickshaw for many years.

Because gasoline has risen significantly in cost, Rehmat’s son wants to convert his rickshaw into a natural gas-powered vehicle, but he hasn’t a CNG (natural gas conversion) kit to do so.

Rehmat is a new member of BRAC and is applying for a 20,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan, Kiva’s field partner, so her son can buy the CNG kit for his rickshaw. Converting his vehicle will mean he can minimize his fuel expenses and increase his income.

Rehmat seems very happy with this loan and wants to say thank you.
