From the moment of conception they have a four month period of gestation, then the piglets are born and for forty days Dora has to be especially careful with them, waiting for the time when she can sell them. Although she knows before hand that it will be difficult to sell her piglets, she is very motivated to continue working in this field. “There is no other option than to continue going forward. I would like to grow my business. I have the necessary structures in place to have enough piglets but in the community there are many neighbors growing and selling pigs so I can’t sell them easily.”

However, Dora’s goal is to see her daughter become a surgeon. This professional desire has been there since childhood because her grandparents were always ailing, and she always wanted to help them get better.

The members of the group are Wilebaldo who will invest by selling rigging ropes; Álvaro who raises, fattens and sells chickens and turkeys; José sells fibers, and Rosario raises and fattens pigs. They are very grateful for the opportunity of receiving a loan funded by people from different parts of the world, and because they have been with VisionFund Mexico for two years they have already seen their activities improve.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

location.town: Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Tagaimurod

texts.ru:
Тагаймурод родом из района Хамадони. В районе Хамадони большая часть населения занимается скотоводством. Основная причина, по которой такая деятельность является популярной это благоприятный климат и природа Республики Таджикистан. Тагаймурод не отстает от других односельчан и развивает свою деятельность дальше. Он хочет закупить несколько голов бычков, чтобы пополнить поголовья крупнорогатых скотин в своем скотном дворе. 
Тагаймуроду 52 года. Он многодетный отец. У него 8 детей. Двое его сыновей работают мигрантами в России, а один сын занимается услугой такси. 
Тагаймурод занимается купле-продажей скота около 10 лет. Ему нравится его деятельность и он намерен заняться таким бизнесом еще надолго.
texts.en: Taigamurod is a native of Hamadoni.  In Hamadoni, a large part of the population is involved in ranching.  The main reason that ranching is so popular has to do with the favorable climate and nature of the Republic of Tajikistan.  Taigamurod is not lagging behind behind other villagers and is developing his own ranching activities further.  He wants to purchase several calves in order to replenish the population of cattle in his cattle yard.  Taigamurod is 52 years old, and is a father many times over.  He has 8 children.  Two of his sons are migrant workers in Russia and one son works as a taxi driver.  Taigamurod has been engaged in the purchasing and selling of cattle for about 10 years.  He likes his work and intends to continue in this business for a long time to come.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Zandra

texts.en:
Zandra is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in jade and silver jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of more silver, jade and tools so she can develop her new designs.

Zandra has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"The first thing I ever made on my own was a pair of silver earrings. My husband taught me so I could help him. I remember watching him work on his own 'til all hours of the night and I really wanted to learn how to craft jewelry. Finally the day came when he asked me to help him and that's how I started. As I saw the jewelry I had been crafting and saw how beautiful it was. It's not been easy getting established as an artisan because silver is very expensive and it's difficult to purchase. But when you set your own mind to it, you can achieve your goals. My greatest dream is to be able to buy a piece of land and build my own house so that I may leave it to my two sons.

I like to work with jade because it is a sacred stone for us Maya people. Jade used to be worn as an amulet, and those who wore the most jade pieces were considered to be the most important people in the community. Rescuing the value of our traditions is always important.

Silver has become a way of life for my family, and little by little I'm teaching my sons so that when they grow up they may choose to continue what their mom and dad began for them. Guatemala offers many opportunities for those of us who like to work hard and now my husband and I have a workshop where we also sell our designs. I strongly believe that everything is possible if one has dreams, and that nothing is impossible if you work hard to achieve your goals."

A message from Zandra: "I have many new ideas in mind for new jewelry pieces, but I need some special tools to be able to make them. I would also like to prepare a good stock in time for the holiday season. That's why I would like to thank you so much for your support through this microcredit. May Good bless you."

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more silver, jade and tools so she can develop her new designs.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino and his family specialize in alpaca and wool weavings, from throws and tapestries to cushion covers and handbags. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool and sheep wool to expand production.

Faustino, pictured here with his wife, Agripina, has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: 

"My parents and grandparents were artisans. So I learned at an early age to weave on rustic looms, to prepare the warp and spin the wool. Our family motto has been: I will never let go of either my grandfather or grandson's hands, for what I have learned from the elders, I will teach to the young. Based on this family philosophy, our work today represents the art that has been passed down from generation to generation within my family. 

"We would like to thank you very much for your support. With this microcredit we'll be able to stock up on alpaca, which is essential for our work. We believe you must be very special people indeed for supporting us this way. We'll always keep you in our hearts."

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool and sheep wool for his weavings.

loans.name: Milorad

texts.en:
Milorad, 49, is a very hard working man who lives in a minority community. He is married and is the father of two children ages 19 and 21 years old. Based on tradition, he works in the agricultural business and started planting vegetables to address the family's needs and to sell to other people in his area. His wife is working in a municipality and sometimes helps her husband when she has free time. 

Currently, Milorad  generates income also by planting wheat and corn and working on the land for other people in the area where he lives. Now he is in need of a loan to pay for a new tractor. The loan will help him to expand and improve his business and generate more income. He hopes that, in this way, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He thanks all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new tractor

loans.name: Leutrim

texts.en:
Leutrim is 22 years old and a happily married father of a 1-year-old son, living in the southern part of Kosovo. He is currently working in a car wash with a very low salary and this is the main source of income for his family. For several years Leutrim has wanted to renovate his house for his family, specifically replacing the doors and windows which are very old.

He has tried unsuccessfully to save the money for the costs and is now requesting a loan before the cold winter months to replace these in order to improve their living conditions and reduce costs on the utilities. His goal is to find a better paying job and ensure the future for his son. Leutrim knows that this is a Kiva loan and he appreciates the help from KosInvest/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new doors and windows because they are very old

loans.name: Esmarlin

texts.es:
Esmarlin es una joven estudiante de Medicina, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder cubrir sus estudios de medicina, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Esmarlin, soy nativa y residente de la provincial San Pedro de Macorís, soy hija de padres divorciados y vivo con mi madre, mi familia es de escasos recursos, mi madre es secretaria de un colegio y mi padre es alguacil, por lo que prácticamente es cuesta arriba costearme mi carrera universitaria, actualmente curso el sexto semestre de medicina.
Amo mi carrera y no quiero perder la oportunidad de terminarla, pero no cuento con los recursos suficientes para seguir adelante y mi única opción es optar por el proyecto Kiva-Fundapec para poder seguir adelante con mis sueños de ser doctora.
Mi deseo es poder ayudar a todo aquel que lo necesita ya que me duele ver como muchos sufren porque no tienen a alguien que les tienda la mano o pueda ofrecerles una consulta médica digna y me duele ver como muchos médicos se pasean en las salas de emergencias siendo indiferentes ante el dolor de muchos que están ahí postrados.
texts.en:
Esmarlin is a young medical student who's requesting a loan to be able to pay for her studies.  This is her story:

My name is Esmarlin.  I'm a native and resident of San Pedro de Macorís Province.  I'm the daughter of divorced parents and I live with my mother.  My family is low income; my mother's a school secretary and my father's in law enforcement.  That's why it's practically an uphill battle to pay for my studies.  I'm currently in my sixth semester of medical school.

I love my program and don't want to miss out on finishing it.  I don't have enough money to continue, however, and my only option is to choose the Kiva-FUNDAPEC project so I can move forward with my dream of being a doctor.

My desire is to be able to help everyone who needs it because it pains me to see how many people suffer when they don't have anyone to lend them a hand or give them a decent doctor's appointment.  It also hurts to see how many doctors there are in emergency rooms who are indifferent to the pain of many of the people who are laid up there.

loans.use: to pay for medical school

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 24 años, es soltero y vive junto con sus tres hermanos.  El trabaja en el Departamento de Informática de una importante empresa hace  años.
Actualmente se encuentra cursando el 5to. Año de la carrera de ingeniería en informática en la UPAP, Carrera que estaría culminando en el primer semestre del año 2014. Aspira a llegar a gerencia el departamento donde esta trabajando o de alguna empresa de prestigio para de esa forma poder mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
Guillermo pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de manutención y también para pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y así seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Guillermo is 24 years old, single and lives together with his three siblings. He has worked in the IT department of an important company for years. He is currently in the 5th year of an engineering degree in Informatics at the UPAP, which would finish in the first half of 2014. He aspires to work in the management team of the department where he is currently working, or in some other prestigious company, and thereby be able to improve his standard of living and that of his family. Guillermo is requesting this loan in order to pay for his maintenance costs and also to be able to pay for his university fees, and thus continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and university fees

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Specializing in goat whey protein isolate, Nicholas’ Austin-based business, RAW, targets athletes, providing them with a wide array of nutritional supplements.

“Goat whey is premium protein available for a diverse market,” Nicholas says. 

Beginning three years ago as a personal trainer, Nicholas has first-hand experience finding the right nutritional supplements for bodybuilding and toning. Though he is new to the retail industry – he had his first sale in July 2013 – Nicholas, 31, has a lot of experience owning and running businesses, including selling alcoholic beverages and operating a pest-control service.

He sells the goat whey at traveling shows.  His next selling and promotional trip will be in Phoenix from November 10-12, 2013.  After his sister applied for a loan in El Paso, Nicholas learned about Accion Texas Inc.

Once he applied and was approved for a loan, he purchased inventory and began website construction. In the meantime, visit his Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/rawnutritions2013#!/rawnutritions2013/

loans.use: to purchase inventory and construct a website

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
MAHAMADOU est mécanicien qui est également vendeur de pièces détachées motos,  il est âgé de  34 ans,  marié à une femme et  père de 5 enfants. Il  vit dans une famille traditionnelle (chez son père avec sa famille) dans la préfecture de Koutiala.  
Dû à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas pu continuer ses études primaires raisons pour laquelle il s’est accroché à la mécanique et la vente de pièces détachées pour motos, qu’il apprit  auprès de son frère il y’a 10 ans. D’après lui, cette activités est très rentable et  lui procure assez de revenus, il reçoit beaucoup de commandes de pièces détachées par  mois. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  MAHAMADOU a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à  son 3ème prêt   individuel.  
Ce prêt servira à acquérir des pièces de rechanges motos en provenance de Bamako. Il effectue son activité dans son garage dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle mixte au comptant et à crédit. 
Avec l’élargissement de son activité, MAHAMADOU espère réaliser un  bénéfice de 75 000 FCFA par mois, qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mahamadou is a  mechanic who also sells motorcycle parts. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of five children. He lives in a traditional family (with his father and his family) in the prefecture of Koutiala.

Due to social reasons he could not pursue his primary studies. This is why he focused on mechanics and selling spare parts for motorcycles, which he learned from his brother 10 years ago. According to him, this business is very profitable and it provides enough income. He gets a lot of orders for spare parts each month.

To ensure good customer satisfaction and to expand his business, Mahamadou approached the  Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is his third individual loan.

This loan will be used to acquire spare motorcycle parts from Bamako. He carries on his business in his garage in the town of Koutiala, to a mixed clientele, for cash or on credit.

With the expansion of his business, Mahamadou hopes to make a profit of 75,000 CFA francs per month he will use to repay the loan, meet his needs and invest the rest in his activities.

loans.use: Purchase spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Jhonar

texts.es: Jhonar, de 24 años es un joven responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que quiere y apoya. Juntos viven en su casa propia, donde vive desde que nació. La actividad que desarrolla desde niño es el bordado de tejidos de manera manual. Inicio esta actividad gracias a la herencia ancestral de sus abuelos, quienes le enseñaron todo el conocimiento que hoy posee. En su localidad todos los pobladores se dedican al bordado de telares con motivos paisajísticos, además de mantas típicas, como también de diversas prendas de vestir. Esta es una actividad que le apasiona y que conoce muy bien. Al principio le fue difícil encontrar compradores pues no tenía muchos contactos, pero poco a poco empezó a abrirse paso y ahora tiene buenos compradores que exportan el arte que realiza. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Jhonar, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de hilos de diversas texturas y colores.
texts.en:
Jhonar is a responsible 24-year-old. He lives in the company of his parents and siblings, whom he loves and supports. They live together in their own home, where he has lived since he was born. The activity that he has developed since childhood is embroidery of fabrics by hand. He started this activity thanks to the ancestral heritage of his grandparents, who taught him all the knowledge that he possesses today. 

In his hometown, all the residents are engaged in the embroidery of landscape motifs, typical blankets, and various clothing garments. This is an activity that he is passionate about and knows very well. At first it was difficult to find buyers because he did not have many contacts, but little by little he began to make headway and now he has good buyers that export the art he makes. 

This is his first loan with Kiva. He feels grateful for the financial support to move forward, and is committed to making his payments in a punctual manner. Jhonar will invest the 500 soles in thread of diverse textures and colors.

loans.use: to buy thread of different colors.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza is a married woman with 7 children. Five of her children are adults and 2 of them attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a shop kiosk business selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. Wanza dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support. With the loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Айнагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Ainagul is 38 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, is raising two children.  Ainagul has a secondary education.  Beginning 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 3000 KGS, Ainagul has been engaged in animal husbandry, which is the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to the hard work of Ainagul, she currently has in her care: 4 milk cows, 1 horse, and 10 sheep.  Her monthly earnings are 8,000 KGS.  WIth the goal of furthering the development of her herd, Ainagul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep for breeding.  With the earnings from her loan Ainagul plans to invest in increasing her herd, and also plans to accumulate funds for further eduction of her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. He has three children and  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, personal business, and he has been doing agricultural work for 12 years..

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming as "earning from agricultural products." His biggest challenge is "lack of funding to increase production." One animal on his farm has been given the name Murgusi.

Jonathan was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. He replied, "To access funds from Juhudi Kilimo to boost agricultural projects." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He responded, "'How [to] work in a group to boost agricultural projects."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this this loan will benefit his family, Jonathan replied, "[It] will boost agricultural projects."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jonathan owns the following at least one cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de dix huit femmes fait partie d'un Banc villageois créé le 15 décembre 2008. Les femmes habitent le même quartier et partagent beaucoup d'activités communes.Elles font du commerce, de la couture et de l’élevage.



Madame Ngaïdo la représentante est âgée de 56 ans.C'est une femme mariée mère de trois enfants dont un garçon. Elle est très dynamique,sérieuse dans son travail; elle a bénéficié deux fois du prêt individuel à la petite entreprise (PIPE). Elle  s'active dans le commerce de tissus et de fruits et légumes; et a une bonne expérience dans ces domaines. Elle est debout à droite la main levée.


Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter des tissus à revendre pendant la période de la Tabaski parce que çà marche bien et elle se fera beaucoup de revenus.


Avec ses bénéfices, elle prend en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of eighteen women is part of a "Banc Villageois" loan association launched on 15 December 2008. The women live in the same neighborhood and share many common activities. They are active in commerce, sewing and raising livestock.

The group representative, Mrs. Ngaïdo, is 56 years old. She is a married woman with three children including a boy. She is very dynamic, serious in her work and was twice granted an individual loan for small businesses (PIPE).

She is active in the trading of fabrics, fruit and vegetables, and has good experience in these areas. She is standing to the right raising her hand.

With this new loan she intends to buy fabrics to resell during Tabaski (holy Muslim day), because it works well and she will be able to generate a lot of income.

With her profits she supports her family's needs.

loans.use: buy fabric for retail sales

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 52 years old. He is married and has 4 children aged 27, 24, 18, and 12. He is a hard working, God-fearing, family man. 

James raises poultry and also has a piggery. His clients are chicken traders in town. He also wants to earn income to cater to his family. 

James will use the money from the loan to buy poultry feed and book another 500 chicks.  He also hopes to buy a motorcycle to transport the chickens.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Batima

texts.ru: Батиме 42 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 4 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Батимы - средне-специальное образование, работает бухгалтером в местной больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Батима занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Батимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 7 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Батима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Батима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Batima is 42 years old, widowed, and after the death of her husband is raising 4 children herself.  She also has her own farm.  Batima has a secondary-specialized education, and works as an accountant in a local hospital.  Beginning 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5000 KGS, Batima's engagement in animal husbandry has been the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to the hard work of Batima, she now has: 1 milk cow, 1 calf, and 7 sheep.  Her monthly earnings are 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her herd, Batima turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 40,000 KGS in order to purchase cows for breeding.  With the earnings from her loan Batima plans to continue to increase her numbers of cattle and also plans to save funds to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Kalssom's Group

texts.en:
Kalssom belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been feeding her seven children. There are only some earning persons who are contributing toward payment of household expenses; her three sons do nothing.

Kalssom has been saving for many years to buy new auto rickshaw for her son, but most of the savings were spent on an operation on her eyes. 
Now she wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for one of these idle sons, but she does not have enough money left to buy one. 

Therefore, Kalssom requested a loan so that she could buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her remaining savings.  She hopes that her son will drive the auto rickshaw with his full devotion and earn sufficient income.

Kalssom is a 45-year-old woman, living with her seven children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Kalssom is very happy after taking this loan and says thank you to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Kalssom is representing herself by raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy new auto rickshaw to drive.

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a married woman with three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamgeni operates a cafe business making constables, like beans and chapati (flat bread), for sale to passersby and neighbours. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing food as her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000 from the loan, she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 56 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 5 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Назиры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назира занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 32 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nazira is 56 years old, widowed, and, after the death of her husband, is raising 5 children herself.  She also runs her own farm.  Nazira has a secondary education.  Beginning 30 years ago, with the purchase of cattle for 400 KGS, Nazira's involvement in animal husbandry has served as the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to the hard work of Nazira, she currently cares for: 1 milk cow, 1 calf, and 32 sheep.  Her monthly income is 7000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her farm, Nazira turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase a calf for breeding.  With the earnings from her loan Nazira plans to continue to increase the size of her herd and also plans to save funds in order to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Asimjan

texts.ru: Асимжан 65 лет, вместе с супругом воспитывает 3 детей. У Асимжан- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Асимжан занимается животноводством, стартовав 40 лет назад, с покупки скота на 100 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Асимжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 жеребец, 1 кобыла. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асимжан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Асимжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en: Asimjan is 65 years old and, together with her husband, is raising 3 children.  Asimjan has a secondary education.  Beginning 40 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 100 KGS, Asimjan's engagement in animal husbandry has served as the primary source of income for her family.  Thanks to the hard work of Asimjan, she currently has in her care: 1 milk cow, 1 stallion, and 1 mare.  Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her farm, Asimjan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase sheep for breeding.  WIth the earnings from her loan Asimjan plans to continue to increase the size of her herd of cattle, and also plans to accumulate funds for on-going construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Peter is married and has one child. Peter works as a carpenter, while his wife is a businesswoman. When he and his wife are not working, they farm their land. They are currently growing sugarcane, maize, and vegetables on their plot. He was interested in starting beekeeping because it is not an expensive activity, and because you harvest more than once per year, it is a good source of income. 

This is Peter’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to start a savings fund to “pay primary school, secondary school and college fees for my children.” When asked about his hopes for the future, Peter had a very specific answer: he wants to “buy more land, buy a motorbike and do business with it, see my children through school, own a powersaw for business of cutting timber, live a better life with my family, and expand my carpentry business.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 32 years old. He is a married male and supports three children, aged 10, 6 and 3 years respectively. Hussein was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff member, and he is a taking his first loan from KADET of 50,000 Kenyan shillings.

He has run a hotel (primitive restaurant) business for three years now located at Marereni, and earns a monthly income of 8,500 shillings. He will use the loan to add stock in his business, including wheat flour, maize flour, oil, sugar, salt and furniture. Also, he will use the anticipated profit to expand his hotel. His hopes and dreams for his future are to expand his business by making it to be a restaurant and to educate and make sure his children live well.

loans.use: To buy more stock, including wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and furniture.
